JeUpocKLIaIebawrjgtKQw.text: Probably the best fish & chips I've ever had! We were actually heading to Turner & Roast for sandwiches, and our cab drove right past Poppies, which I had also bookmarked since it is highly recommended for their fish & chips. Since we only had one sandwich at T&R, we decided to split an order of fish & chips at Poppies. There was a small line when we got there around 7:30pm on a Saturday, but we were sat within 10 minutes. They also have a separate take-out order line, and a lot of people were going that route. There is a small bench outside to eat your food if you prefer. We ordered:-Large Cod Supper (Fried in Groundnut Oil, Served w/Chips & Homemade Tartar Sauce, £12.50, yelp.com/biz_photos/popp…): Delicious! The large order was HUGE, and I wouldn't be able to finish this on my own. The fish was perfectly cooked, and super crunchy outside but nice and flaky inside. The chips were also delicious, and had a nice crisp. You can't skimp on the salt though. I also really liked the homemade tartar sauce, but had to ask them for more since they give you so little. A must order!-Roll & Butter (£1.50/each, yelp.com/biz_photos/popp…): The roll was really soft, and comes already buttered. Good, but nothing special.-Cartmel Sticky Toffee Pudding (Served w/Scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream, £4.60, yelp.com/biz_photos/popp…): Delicious, and a must order! The sticky toffee pudding comes out nice and warm, and goes really well with the scoop of cold ice cream. Overall, I had a great meal at Poppies, and this is a must stop if you are in London and like fish and chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cartmel Sticky Toffee Pudding (Served w/Scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream, 4.60)
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Roll & Butter (1.50/each)
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large Cod Supper (Fried in Groundnut Oil, Served w/Chips & Homemade Tartar Sauce, 12.50)

p1bIJO1yGxVkM7sHwt-QoA.text: It's been two years since my first visit to Poppies in Shoreditch/Spitalfields. Well, two years later and I'm still a fan. My friends and I needed a quick lunch and walked from our flat off Brick Lane. We arrived a bit after lunch time and asked if we could get a table without a reservation. We were glad to be able to get a table. The staff greeted us warmly and sat us at a table in the back of the restaurant, which quickly filled up with others. I chose to order fish and chips, preferring the Haddock to the Cod but was told they were out of Haddock. So, I switched to Cod. I then ordered a Fentiman's Ginger Beer... but the server gave me a sheepish grin and said with regret that they were out of that too.  I laughed and switched to a Victorian Lemonade. Well, everything was just as delightful was it was two years ago. It was nice to not be "under the weather" (I had the flu, btw) and to be able to taste my food more fully. I can imagine that I'll be back to Poppies when I'm back in London.

QEGtBynOzTK8hg5lrwl62g.text: I think I was a little too hopeful when I came here for the first time. I was in spitalfields market and shoreditch area and I checked yelp to suggest me a place so there I was. When I came there was a bit of line but I didn't wait that long and we ordered before we sat down and the food came quickly once we were settled. We ordered the seafood platter and haddock fish 'n chips. I was a bit let down because the chips were no longer warm. It was just mildly warm. The fish and seafood were great so had no complaint on that. But the chips were ordinary and rather dismaying. We ordered desserts but unfortunately they were ran out of the pudding and apple pie. So we were left with ice creams, chocolate and strawberry flavors. They were just ordinary but I thought the strawberry was better than the chocolate. They are said to be the champion of national fish 'n' chips competition 2014 but I can tell you there is another place I would choose to get my perfect fish 'n chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Inside poppies
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Poppies strawberry and dark chocolate ice cream
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Seafood platter with delicious calamari, fish, chips and tar tar sauce

NEAEc_DmOahyOuTRjn17lg.text: We were across the street at Old Spitalfields Market when I noticed Poppie's in-market outpost and knew the time was right for a heapin' portion of fish-n-chips. The staff was friendly in orienting us to the menu options and making sure we had a complete selection of lemon and sauces... very good service, I'd say. The fish fry batter was glistening, delicate, and crispy.. the cod was huge, hot, clean, and flakey. The real star is the fish.. the chips were only so-so.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

QWEAt6LXuuaaMLsUOAao8g.text: Hey UK visitors, this is it: Fish & chips without the fuss. "Oh, but what fuss could fish & chips possibly bring?" you UK natives may ask. Let me count the ways in which traditional fish & chips spots may fluster your average outsider:1. No seating at some traditional take-out counters2. Questionable hygiene of real newspaper wrapping3. Intimidatingly brisk customer service4. Lack of epically delicious sticky toffee puddingIf you are from abroad or are looking for a safe place to please visitors, Poppy's has got your back. If you are in the mood for a reasonably-priced meal around Shoreditch, Poppy's is peppy. Just proceed with caution vis-a-vis the candy they give you with the bill--all four of us Americans thought it was gross.

uDPazGCV7JbrzVveVyL8sA.text: Poppies is infamous for their wonderful fish and chips - I can't quite believe it took me this long to come and sample the fare!I had a small Cod supper when I went this week - I couldn't even finish the small portion, so the large portions are only for the ravenous! My friend had a battered sausage which disappeared pretty quickly and was declared "one of the best ever" - from someone who grew up on the coast, this is a huge accolade.The staff were very friendly and fast, and it's a nice little place. If I could give it 4.5 stars I would - it loses the half mark only because it's relatively pricey, and also because I'm not convinced that it's particularly memorable. That said, I wouldn't have any problem with going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

DUjNRyo8xn3oXLcZCgVHXQ.text: Working near by, you'd think that this would be a solid place to have late lunch or diner.  Greeted by someone who was obviously the manager, would lead you to believe that he would treat dinners with respect and humility; how wrong was I! It is amazing how far a smile can go! From the moment we enter to the moment we left, we ushered to eat quickly, pay up and leave. Now the bad parts, seated in worst possible position whilst the rest of the restaurant reminded unoccupied. The food: Soggy half cooked chips and batter-less cod.  Never again!

VCbLBcN-4C8gx_aYpJ2RgQ.text: Great jellied eels and cod fish and chip

FcqTW7c7nP0UEfTPlFD4SQ.text: Don't do it! Awfully bland, just not good. It smells fantastic from the outside, the service is great, but the fish and chips are terrible. Ugh.

_a0-krGUrlVs8p4ywBIcpg.text: Hands down the best fish and chips I have ever had.I usually opt out of ordering this dish because it's usually over battered and greasy. This was nothing like that.The fish was moist and quite delicious. I'm glad that I was able to stop by here during my trip to London.

ZghR9zlK8yx5Z2hnaGVD9g.text: The cod and chips was fine but too expensive for what is offers. Definitely overrated. It feels a bit touristy and I did notice for example that the packaging is very nice if you like that. I also cannot complain with the service.

qI_DULqYefE4507x_WJ0Pw.text: Nothing too crazy. I got the cod plate. I felt like it was exactly what I paid for. Since I'm not a huge fan of fried foods, I don't think I'd come back. But I'd still recommend for anyone who wants to try good ol' fish n' chips.I really liked the atmosphere though, it was cozy and felt like a diner. I loved the ketchup. Tartar sauce was also good even though it's generally not my favorite sauce.

VC7SQKLZ36W7QCaSavzq3Q.text: The cod was thick, moist and fresh with a crispy battered shell. The side of steak cut fries aka "chips", was not seasoned with any salt but firm. This can be good in a way if a customer wishes to salt their own "chips". The green mushy beans were seasoned well but I wasn't really a fan of.Place was busy and usually a wait for a table. However, if you don't mind taking a brief walked around the block, there are plenty of open picnic tables and benches open to the general food court type area.Overall, good eats!!

Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

fP842-9LtQtTI3FP3yQEsg.text: I'm so glad we stumbled upon this place.  My boyfriend and I shared the large haddock fish & chips and it was one of the most memorable meals on our Euro trip.  For $14 bucks, it was more than enough for the both of us.  Although the fish itself is extremely large, the containers for tartar sauce and ketchup were teeny tiny.  We had to ask the waitresses multiple times for more.  :)  If you're ever in London, be sure to stop by this cute restaurant for a  bite.

c4maq19h2wZNLgZP3goJQA.text: The fish and chips here were average at best. We're giving it two stars instead of three because it was extremely overpriced. Although they seem to advertise it as a traditional fish and chip shop it seems to be overdone for the tourists.  In fact it seems to be a destination for walking tours.

Cw86J0ubJfiwZHtA7JcHjg.text: Very light and flaky,A throwback to the fifties,Always a long queue.

XIxKAwvbWCk5T582_abKuQ.text: Really really good fish and chips, reasonably priced for the area too. Working just down the road from here we often have fish and chip Friday's - a lot of people have the same idea so it's worth pre-ordering if you're taking away! The queue out the door show how popular this place is, they have opened a smaller one in spitalfields market which is quieter.

sB5utPbOq5Rtei5p__lCWQ.text: When I was taken there I thought - wait, what can be so special about fish&chips. Well, I was wrong!Love the design from the 50s and the fact that you get your fish&chips in a newspaper (imitation of a newspaper for health&safety purposes)!

nw-FrpQl4xkZ-mONStTFhw.text: This place is so fun. It's old, old school diner style - from the server's outfits to the decor and design. That's really fun. Four of us came at 12:45 and were seated promptly and ordered four rounds of cod fish and chips. Came out fresh and hot just a few minutes later. The fish was crispy, but slightly overcooked in my opinion. The fries weren't my favorite - not crispy and salty - but not counting that against them since I think they were just not my style. Overall, mighty tasty fish and chips in Shoreditch! Would give a 3.5 if possible.

DEQFUPfRyEvJct6tzhBRuw.text: Good food, slightly too expensive and definitely too noisy.We had regular cod fish n chips and it was as good as you'd expect. Generous portions and average quality.We were very disappointed by the calamari though: we ordered an appetizer to share amongst the four of us, and we got 6 sad calamari rings, paying them something like 1.5 pounds each. Meh.The beer was basically water (camden pale ale), but I guess that's just me having trouble with the British taste, although a wider selection wouldn't hurt.What really bothered me was the live band: don't get me wrong, they were really talented, simply the dining room was too small and the volume too high, resulting in an annoying experience where it was impossible to exchange even a few words.An ok experience overall, but I can't recommend the place.

3OIf5EucicyuXD6Sb2PH5A.text: My family was visiting from NYC and wanted to try "real fish & chips", so being that this was really the only place I knew of, and it's walking distance from our house, we went to Poppies.The good- the sticky toffee pudding and ice cream are amazing! I would go back for that alone! In general, every enjoyed their food, though honestly, I don't know that we are the most discerning consumers...The bad- getting a table seemed to be such effort considering that there was space. They even had the dinning area roped off, like it was some super exclusive joint (if you can't tell, I was a bit annoyed by that)...In any case, it got the job done... not sure I'll go back until the next group of out-of-towners show up...

p1M83uSuFEL3_p2FMCp2Tg.text: Not the cheapest place, but well worth a try. Fresh tasting and not stale greasy. Probably wouldn't travel all the way across London for it, but if you are in the City or East End, its worth the trip.

Jx_GDKxC6DvJSXDk5Adv2Q.text: yum great fish and chips! the fish was incredible. personally i prefer crispier smaller chips but this is the traditional so cant complain was delish.

rvhf1pIW2ljHaRcdAx5n_A.text: This is just how I imagined fish and chips to be. The fish was flaky, nice thickness, just the right amount of coating and delicious. The only thing I would add is a little spice, my personal preference. But otherwise delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

XiJ_ySyw4AXUGs8yxhYJ8A.text: Takeaway fish and chips review:Ketchup: You have to pay for it, comes in a sachet.Fork/knife: Free with purchase.Salt/Vinegar: freeI had chips and haddock and it was delish! Service: friendly and with a smile

UoPyERiSV8k1YpL2CGXIAw.text: Looked for the best Fish n Chips in London. Poppies came top on most lists so I figured why not?I was very surprised in several ways.The food was excellent! The fishmonger has an excellent eye for fish. I had the old staple Cod and Chips. The Cod was clearly fresh and the batter was light and complimented the fish well. No grease or oil in sight. Chips were crisp outside and done just right inside. The oil used must be replaced regularly as the restaurant did not smell of old oil and the food was fresh. In addition I couldn't resist the Mushy Peas - home made & tasty.This was one of the few times I've seen Ginger Beer on the menu - also a worthy choice.The décor is a throw back to the 50's and 60's as was the sweet selection presented with the bill - Black Jacks and Fruit Salad!Visit soon.I'll be back!

BuGGECvZpskTN4Q7-oRbpw.text: This place is rocking at lunch time. The fish and chips were great. The staff is really friendly anx interact with  the customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

WrLtNUj4YD5OX_DCJa_uWg.text: Highly Recommended.  Of the 3 Fish-and-chips locations we tried, this was the best.  Many locals here so it makes sense.

7uElFAqJO7l4FtmMyPCmrw.text: I don't really like fish and chips.  That being said, since we were in London I felt compelled to give it another try.  I still don't like fish and chips but there was nothing wrong with Poppies' version -- the meal is just not for me.Anyway, this review is really about the sticky toffee pudding.  I had never had it before and was blown away by how delicious it was.  I'd come back just for the dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Sticky Toffee Pudding!!!
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Ginger beer

RvkY5focVgydaJMuweVikQ.text: At first, I was a little turned off by the very commercialized look of the food and the gimmicky-ness of the brand, from the pre-fried, heat-lamped pieces of fried sausage and fish to the 50s decor and higher pricing. But ends up, this was everything I ever wanted in fish and chips. Crunchy batter breading on fresh, big pieces of cod, and chips/fries that were a delight to behold and to bite into. Seriously - I think they were made of Yukon Golds or some other kind of rich, silky potato, because they fell apart after the crunch layer like creamy mashed potatoes. Delectable, and worthy of knocking off my Ireland travels for the best fish and chips for those fries alone. Mushy peas were nice and green tasting. I do wish they'd made their own tartar sauce instead of using Heinz and that they didn't charge for ketchup (Really? When it's already $13+ for a quick platter to eat on the street? And WAY more to eat at a table), but I can't really knock a working formula.

xAH-G-iYTmAUpYXPWNCKyA.text: Visiting London from the US, we had heard about Poppies from video bloggers saying it was a classic place to eat traditional Fish and Chips. However, my wife and I were unfortunately disappointed. We ordered two large Haddock dinners with chips and a starter of Calamari. The fish was mushy and the outside was not crisp. It did not seem fresh. The chips were not hot and crisp. We think the food was prepared ahead of time and not at the time of our order. The Calamari rings also had a musty taste. Despite the reputation, the food experience was lacking. It was not one of our favorite meals in London.

v8Nofe82WMuCJK0oUGs6sg.text: The friendliest staff and the most amazing fish and chips I have ever had. I had the Haddock and chips and the bread and butter. I am a huge bread lover and this is probably the best bread and butter I have ever had too.

pXxMJRFAeOtnRopbtwnqpg.text: Poppies is a great place for fish and chips. My boyfriend ordered the cod and I ordered the halibut. Both fish were good. The halibut is dryer than the cod but both are equally delicious. The chips (fries) were good as they came fresh out of the fryer. When I first saw how the chips looked like, it looked pretty basic. But they come out piping out of the fryer. It's not as oily as other fish and chips and they don't use much batter so you're still getting the good amount of fried batter to the fish. You also don't feel too heavy from the fried fish or get that oily feeling. Compared to fish and chips in California, fish and chips here are way better. Tip: The take away menu is cheaper than dining in.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish (Halibut) and chips with a side of mushy peas

MWSt-zmcFh_yhah3j20hkA.text: For our first meal in London, my friends and I wanted to get some fish and chips. After looking on yelp, we found Poppies that was close by and had our dinner there. It was a pretty busy place with a line waiting outside. Getting an order to go is probably faster. We waited about 30 minutes and finally got our seats. I shared a hot seafood platter with my friends so we could try a bit of everything. It came with cod bites, scampi, calamari, and whitebait. The whitebait was a bit too fishy for us, we all enjoyed the cod the most. We also had haddock n chips and chicken pie and definitely way too much food for the night. I thought everything was pretty good.

Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

fOD9crxUZfPNsTeaQEQybA.text: With Poppies' reputation as the best fish & chips in London, I expected better. Maybe I went there on an off day, but the fish was kinda bland and the chips were meh, and I wasn't really inspired to give it another try. The saving grace of our visit was the sticky toffee pudding. Ah-mazing. Best I've had in London. Even if you skip the fish & chips, get the sticky toffee pudding.

sy_9wu8ffrj9NAQodvd-Iw.text: Went here for fresh fish and chips on our trip to London. The owner (or manager) was excellent and so very accommodating. They were packed and sold out of some of their fish variations (but this is how we know they are fresh!) My parents actually returned for lunch the next day because it was so delicious. Will certainly be back on our next trip to London.

4_ronloQS4cCi7_w5Er6lw.text: It's a smaller restaurant with the tables close together, but it does fish and chips pretty well. I got a regular cod, which was quite filling. It comes with one large piece of fish and a good portion of chips. The fish breading was well seasoned, but my piece of fish was dry. The chips were great - a good mix of crunchy and soft. The service is quick and friendly. Not the best fish and chips that I've had, but it certainly hit the spot.

T7H1LQOpeZmHSOKfbLKCLg.text: Wish the Chips (3 Stars) were crispier, maybe some salt - but the Haddock was moist and very tasty (5 Stars). Hot, crispy batter, and although I only selected a 'regular' order, it was large enough that only one piece was needed.Got lucky and choose a very good and fairly hoppy local beer - which paired perfectly with the Haddock, and provided that extra bit of citrus that was missing on the plate.Service was great, but arrive on the early side. The line gets long quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Haddock Fish & Chips

4u447VEbwg-GOwSg4EDjsw.text: This is has been a family tradition every time we go to London. A lunchtime sit down meal of good ol' fish 'n' chips. It's a small & compact place & sometimes you have to wait to be seated. I believe the longest we've ever waited was about 15 minutes. However, it is so worth it!The waitresses are always dressed in a 1940's/50's style, which is always great to see.The staff are friendly & efficient. The food itself is a real joy to eat. Hot, freshly cooked, not greasy, more than ample servings. I also love the fact you can get a pot of tea with your meal.There's also take away service if you're in a rush or don't want to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Traditional fish 'n' chips

9pr2zqSiRlxEHTTiWCQ_Ug.text: Stopped in here on a rainy day waking around Shoreditch. I needed a good fish and chips and this place had awesome reviews. The inside is adorable with little knick knacks everywhere. Staff was friendly and oh my gosh the fish and chips was SO GOOD! Large portions that you will definitely finish solely because it's so good you can't stop eating.

ljTSGtJP4_BfclMJ6YuWiw.text: Lovely bag of chips - fresh and hot and cooked just right and £1.50 which is reasonably priced. Haven't tried the fish yet but I'll come back.

qIoioPQ69wP5OHlPtZsnVA.text: Fantastic time at Poppies.  Excellent fish and chips and many more items.  Wonderful service and hospitality.

8Dv-aIqjFGQr5PnUo5-Gvg.text: Great classic fish 'n' chips fayre.  Wide range of fish and chicken options, cosy atmosphere, friendly waiters.  The cod was cooked to perfection.  Enormous portions too, entirely fill the plate.  Try both the mushy peas and pickled egg sides!

rfUmc4iFLd7wKXiRi2JMyA.text: I was rather disappointed by the fish and chips here. The texture of the fish was crispy but rather bland. The chips were soggy. I had the chicken, which was well, just chicken. We also shared a side of gherkin and some cream sodas. All in all, not worth a second trip. There are two lines, one for dine in and one for take out!

Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

9Y5fh1m9j7MNKKY3uN_qGw.text: In London we had to get our fish and chips on at Poppies. Fresh and delish! And the sticky toffee pudding desert is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Caramel Sticky Toffee Pudding with ice cream
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips (cod)

Fl-cKN78pQadpByvOxr9DQ.text: I don't like fries so my review is biased. We finally ordered fish and chips! But it was actually cod and chips. Is it usually cod? "Chips" are french fries! Fries are potato chips. I thought they literally served fish with potato chips. I can't compare to other fish and chips joint since this was my first and last experience. It's just deep fried fish..not sure what the huge deal is. They also charge for sauce - lame. On the plus side, the fish wasn't dry! We ordered the smallest size and it was still too big for the two of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips

ilkhZ_4O3liaKm4dr8qAJQ.text: Good, solid fish and chips.  Nice staff.  Nothing to complain about.  Will eat here again.

4J-j2KLr3VuUNUTKX98Irw.text: I honestly don't get the hype. Was in London for 8 nights on a business trip and my colleagues and I were hell bent on finding some great fish n chips. This place not only specializes in just that, but has loads of great reviews and a line out the door...the question is WHY exactly? The table seating is tight as hell (we were basically sharing a table with the guys next to us so we eventually ended up merging conversations with them) and the food was definitely bland. We of course ordered the fish n chips, the seafood appetizer (all fried), and some mushy peas. Nothing to write home about and it took all three sauces to make them palatable. The peas tasted like something I would feed my 18 month old twins (if I was mad at them in life) and the batter was unsalted. Beer selection was decent and the service was decent (you get licorice with your bill) but I felt like all the tourists around us were in the same confused boat wishing we had caught some different fish.

pdbnOlApixlL6zzh9Liwpg.text: They claim to have the best fish and chips in London. I don't have a lot to compare it to, but I definitely enjoyed it. They have two sizes and the normal size was plenty for one. My friend got the chicken, which was okay, but not the best recommended thing on here. Would definitely get the fish and chips if you're going here.This is a stand that doesn't have anywhere to sit, so you have to find a seat which can be kind of hectic. I thought it was kind of ridiculous they charged extra for ketchup and tarter sauce, but maybe that's a UK thing. Overall, good place to grab fish and chips in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

7cAMcf1saF8S_HedDHx4bA.text: Poppies is a cute retro themed restaurant specializing in fish and chips.I had cod fish since the waitress mentioned that's the classic choice. The fried fish is really fresh and moist! The ketchup and tartar sauce are all in cute little jars. Great place to grab a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish and chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

lJyB7BO-FgOrVsnaDrGVTA.text: I had to try the ubiquitous fish and chips during my stay in London so why not go to the best? Poppies!I entered and found myself cordoned off in to a small space for takeout orders. I'm not sure what is required to sit in the dining room but I didn't qualify, since I wanted the food to go anyway. I then ordered the basic fish and chips with cod, which I believe is the default. Shockingly, they had run out of chips but I was good with that since I figured I'd be getting fresh ones.After paying, more folks came in just seeking chips so we all kind of crammed in this space. One of the gentleman was clearly wasted and was wearing a stuffed turkey on his head. I kid you not. Apparently, this is a thing if you are drunk and in London? Or not. Either way, it was hilarious and the shop keepers didn't know what to make of it. "Gobble! Gobble!" I said enthusiastically. Then, he claimed it was a chicken and not a rooster. Rather than starting a huge argument about bird identification, I went with it.I then ordered some mushy peas but everyone there simultaneously said this was a bad idea! F it, I said. I've never had mushy peas before so I'm going to have some now. They are a brilliant steaming green pile of, get this, mushy peas. Perhaps I should have listened but when I tried them later, they really weren't bad.I got salt and malt vinegar on my fish and chips because they were offered and I figured, why not?! As I ate them back in the apartment, the vinegar was a definite plus flavor-wise but it helped make the chips soggy which isn't a good thing. I  clearly needed more salt which helped. Fresh black pepper helped also because, let's face it, there isn't a lot of flavor in fish and chips.So, now I've eaten the finest of London's fish and chips. I can't honestly say I'm a fan but I'm happy to have done it and I'll now move on with my life.

jlNxpDGYgC8uAnrKt79YEw.text: 20-25 min train ride and walk to get from my hotel here. I was excited because I love fish and chips and was eager to get some authentic FnC! All I can say it was ok. It was hot and fresh but it was only ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Outside the place from across the street...
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Inside the place...
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Great story...

vJoXbUnP1WgCktZeJbGcTg.text: Hotel was just around the corner and decided fish and chips would be our first meal in London. Poppies did not disappoint! Large serving of fried fish with chips for £12 ish. Had a cider with it. Saw another couple with mushy peas and should have asked to order it as well. Open late! Decent service. Recommended.

2ytj8s-4cDS2XYjW_9GgiQ.text: Best fish and chips ever!  So flakey and fresh!  Did not taste fishy at all.  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

mkf7ycHIZe3TFL7Z4SQVnQ.text: I don't get it. The vibe of the place is cool, but the cod was tasteless - it tested like fried...just fried, not fish. The chips were flavorless but the mushy peas were the best part. Not worth the price or the wait IMO. :(

CtMdR-SAKQwIJFnSqiubmQ.text: Great fish and chips shop in Spitalfields. Dine in or takeaway. I would suggest having your meal with a beer. It's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

HiGc4skv45DTaw2hn3RypQ.text: Overpriced. Not fresh. Not great quality. Over cooked. Not fresh again even stale.Extremely poor customer service, constantly rushing us and not let us seated until everyone is here even though over the half the party is already around and the shop is half empty on a Monday. Again, extremely rude waitress, who obviously just had a bad day and giving it to us!I'm glad they didn't put in a service charge, they don't even deserve my extra penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Stale/not fresh and extremely poor customer service
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Stale/not fresh
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Stale/not fresh

xuxr9h9zxBZuLvlNxWlNtQ.text: Went on my first Eurotrip 2 weeks ago and prior to leaving my BF recommended Poppies fish and chips. My BF is a foodie and hearing him talk about Poppies during his time in London made me really curious. My friends and I decided to find Poppies in our second night in London. We got to the place late so they were out on a lot of the items on the menu; luckily, the cod wasn't one of them. We all got the regular size cod and chips. The cod was yummy, perfectly battered and cooked perfectly to golden brown. My friend thought it was the best fish and chips he ever had! The homemade tartar sauce was yummy, but I still think Andria's seafood in Ventura is the best homemade tartar sauce I've had. I thought it was cute that they serve their ketchup and tartar sauce in the tiny little jars. Sticky toffee pudding with ice cream was yummy! I only had a small taste because I don't really care for dessert, but their toffee pudding was better than what I've had in the past.Service was awesome, very friendly and accommodating staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

CMergjteD9khblY0VsivEQ.text: Pricey, but delicious. I LOVED THEIR MUSHY PEAS. The fish was very fresh (like they caught it an hour before served it) and flaky, and was extremely hot when it came out to us. It wasn't overly salty, but yes, it was very oily. What can you expect from fish and chips? If there isn't a bunch of oil, it probably isn't any good.I loved the vibe and the service was great too!

-1H9AeS3pGPY7b-RJ5VrDQ.text: First meal in London. Service was great, really attentive and always ready to help. We all had the traditional fish and chips with cod. Meals came fast and were hot and tasty. I would recommend getting the regular size as I couldn't tell where mine was larger than the others (so 3 quid spend for...?). And although it's cute to have the condiments in small jars its rather uncomfortable and just too small of a portion. Was through my ketchup and sauce tartar and got half of my meal left to eat dry. But I would definitely come here again. It was a  traditional experience!

oBwOBJYI275Z5Z9iSG8e3g.text: Worth the hype. Fish was cooked perfectly. Chips were a tad dry but still good! Got seated pretty quickly and food was out within 10 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Regular Haddock and Chips. Huge piece of fish.

_FgShrMRTALNfiaEFeGDBg.text: Tried this place out on my 2nd last evening in London. Had to do some traditional British stuff :-). Thanks to fellow yelpers, I knew exactly what needed to be ordered. I got the Regular Haddock Fish & Chips..Taste wise (and I suppose the Indian in me), I always expect the batter to be tasty & have some spice (weird right?). So yes, the batter didn't impress me that much. I mean, imagine some Cajun powder mixed with batter? Brings a whole different taste to your dish, doesn't it?The batter is quite bland, but not greasy at all. So that was definitely good. The fish on the other hand was absolutely brilliant. Really well cooked (or rather perfect amount of cooking). Had a very nice fishy taste to it.. The chips we a little greasy and too much in portion. I couldn't finish mine. Again, if their tables had a bottle of Tobasco sauce, maybe I would have gulped both of them down ;-).Ambiance wise, it's really fun atmosphere. There was a speaker right above me, so the music obviously felt a little loud.. but still, a fun place!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Regular Haddock & Chips

WocM8XR-z4escBzOwYPuaQ.text: The British don't seem to fall for mid-20th century nostalgia like we Americans do.  They go for Victorian, WWI, or Camelot....But Poppies is a restaurant that leans heavily on TV, radio, and advertising from the post-WWII era.       And of course, they serve that most nostalgic of British dishes...eel pies.  Just kidding, fish n'chips.  (Though were can you get jellied eels and old victorian-style meat pies in London?)    Poppies has become very popular because its fish n'chips has been rated tops in London.   And is it?   In my humble opinion, it's pretty good.   But is there ever a "best" pizza or hamburger?    I dunno... It's good... This place, due to its location, is frequented by hipsters (the East End has kind of become London's Brooklyn), and it's been discovered by tourists (there are even tours that stop here).     But there is a lot of bad fish in London... so maybe finding a spot with good fish is all worth it.   Plus they have erstwhile hipster waitresses in old 1950's uniforms.

DN8N0jZ6bFP9hFN4QgM4ZQ.text: Easily the best fish n' chips in London.It's cheapest (and quickest) to grab takeaway, but if you take the time to have a meal there it's a real treat. The whole place feels a bit lost in time, like a 40's diner that just kept on going.The fish n' chips themselves are gigantic, which means you can split with a friend and still have room for the second reason to eat in...The Cartmel sticky toffee pudding.It's beyond amazing. It's the ultimate version of the ultimate British dessert. You must get it because reasons.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cartmel sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large Haddock n' chips

ICxvvjrfFb7GTJWYPBR4iw.text: The fish and chips were nothing short of perfection. We ordered a cod and haddock meal to try both. Also tried the mushy peas and fish cake. If I come back to London I will definitely dine here again. Also tried two types of lagers too. All n all it exceeded my already high expectations.The restaurant decor is nice and everyone was extremely friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large Cod meal.
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large Haddock meal.

CutPLNfISTT84t-zDaX4iA.text: There's a reason this place is always so crowded.  Fish n Chips (Haddock w/ skin) was insane.  Best I've tasted (besides the Lion and Key in Hull).There are 2 distinct vibes here:  inside seating (calm, bright, small and warm) and outside stainless steel table (street style and where the action is).We did outside.  It was raining and there was an awning to protect us.  The malt vinegar and salt are lashed to the metal table so they don't get knocked off by drunk people or stolen.Don't half step.  A full order is good if you're totally wasted.  Otherwise get a small order or split a large with a friend.

4aIq958aZCeRT9o_o2xYfA.text: Very famous so had to stop in when friends were in town and we it caught by soutalfields looking to eat.Were seated quickly and the room was clean. I don't think I'll be back: the food was a bit too greasy and overpriced for what it is - you can probably do better at any quality pub. Also, the service felt rushed and didn't add to the experience.

tywugtA5qf-tDIfqFXTgLA.text: The calamari and chips are absolutely delicious. Super crispy, homemade tartar sauce, and very large portion - I think I got 10 rings plus a generous helping of chips! By the end of the meal I was stuffed and very pleased. My boyfriend ordered the cod which he said was also fried to perfection (though he wasn't so impressed by the portion, just okay with it). Not too expensive either especially considering the size of the plate! Will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Calamari
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

wBzIn3YSWu3kBOqc_5G2_A.text: Delicious! Only wish the chips were crispier since I've seen chef shows where they talk about the chips being fried twice. You have to try mushy peas or gravy with your chips but it wasn't for me or my companions. The toffee pudding is heaven. You HAVE to try that. The servers were all dressed up, it was cute. All in all, great service, delicious food.

PiCf72tfXrH0KyhGz5rOdg.text: Greasy, overpriced, and overrated. There are plenty of other local stores that serve more and tastier food for less. This convinced me for a while that I didn't like fish n'chips, but the reality was that their food was subpar. Not to mention, their service isn't too great either. I would never recommend this to a friend.

Xtxuo5Lzgmjr_F4usDWHug.text: I am torn between giving this place three or four stars, so I took the latter.The place is a madhouse and packed to the gills with hungry diners. We weren't sure how long the wait for a table might be, yet we took a chance that it would be worth it.Hubby ordered cod; I got haddock. The fish is DELICIOUS! It was crisp, flaky, and full of fresh-fish flavor. There are two negatives, though.  First, the chips could have been more crisp. Maybe growing up on North America has spoiled me to fried potatoes being absolutely crispy. The chips were quite tasty, despite the non-crispness. The one thing I hope never to encounter again is mushy peas. I've never encountered a dish of peas that didn't taste like peas. I suppose that not growing up in the British Isles, I'm not accustomed to the taste of these things, I shall refrain from calling them food. This green substance didn't taste at all like peas, but some sort of horrible bean dish. I added vinegar to what I'd had on my plate, and it made them somewhat palatable. We were both very glad to have plenty of fish left to take away the horrific taste of it.Again, the negatives are coming from someone who's grown up in the land of crispy fries and peas tasting like peas. I firmly believe that this place is worth the wait, and we'll probably be back before heading home to the states.

7PN3Yqwm5MDrEt3bIGOL3A.text: Came to Poppie's by recommendation from a local. My husband and I split the large fish and chips order since neither of us were hungry enough for a full meal. Turns out this seems like a common enough thing to do.The good:Food was overall delicious. Probably the best fish I've had in a long time, short of a family fish fry. Chips were pretty standard. Had a nice presentation and the homemade tartar sauce was delicious. The not so good:Service. I'm not sure if it's just us being American, but it took about 20 minutes to clear our plates from the table post meal. Keep in mind that this is a tiny restaurant and that other people were coming and going around us. After our plates were taken, we waited another 20 minutes for the check. My husband actually went to ask for it and was told to "relax and we'll bring it to you." Wellllllll, I think we'd been relaxing long enough already. With all time, it took us 2 hours to get in and out, which totally drained time on our first day in the city. I get that service isn't the same everywhere, but this was pretty outlandish.In summary, great fish and chips. Get takeaway and save yourself a pound or two and five hours of your time.

P9HQpBDqxLXdAT5p3HXddQ.text: Not sure what the hype was about for these fish and chips. I've had better elsewhere. Batter was good but the fish was overcooked. Fries are too soggy for my tastes. Are these really the best london has to offer? Portions are generous though which I appreciated. I couldn't finish it all.

vTE3hjCvUWSUmAzsS2jjMw.text: You can't visit London and not eat fish and chips! So naturally I had to do my research and find a good place to dine at. Poppies had been voted one of the best places for fish and chips so I wanted to see if it lived up to all the hype.The theme of the restaurant is very 1950s from the waiters outfits to the jukebox and music, which I absolutely adore so I was already thrilled. I ordered the classic fish and chips and my uncle ordered the calamari and chips. We did what i like to call a "swap", which is when we share half our meal with the other person that way we can taste two meals at the same time. Both meals were huge I got the "regular" size portion but couldn't believe that they actually offer a bigger size than that because it was a really big piece of cod. Everything was absolutely delicious and  we were stuffed by the end of the meal. I also ordered a cream soda to drink, which made me happy because so few restaurants actually offer cream soda in the states and its one of my favorites. Our servers were very friendly and welcoming as well. I would love to come back if I'm ever in London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. The famous fish & chips!
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cream soda!

JRlM4CA42YBCoRFfgXq1LQ.text: Not a big fan of fish and chips, but...You gotta try their cod! I had more than 3 "fish and chips" in 7 days and this is the best and the only one that makes me realize why this is a "must-have" dishin UK.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

IYxmC8sFVem38sCgC2cLQg.text: Delicious and fun. We especially enjoyed the Haddock and tartare sauce. Worth the long wait time!

XelQul8nAgGvbYPBLtH1mA.text: My first impression of this place was "If you need reservations for fish and chips then the place has to be off the hook!" They are on Open Table, they must be legit!That's what most people would think right?!? So I don't know if maybe I over hyped myself up for this place or my standards for fish and chips got higher but this place didn't blow my socks off... First off, like the great planner I am, I made reservations for dinner here for a weeknight. Unfortunately for us, there was  a delay on the tube and we missed out reservation time by 10 minutes. Upon arrival I explained our situation and the hostess explained that they had given our table away and that we would have to wait in the que and that they would "see what they could do". Luckily the 3 groups in front of us opted for carry away instead and cut down our wait to about 15 minutes. Guess we lucked out... This place is small and felt like a maze just trying to get seated. We got seated near the window and ended up having to share our table with a group of French teenies who got seated right after us; no biggie. However word to the wise, if you enjoy your private space or are looking for ambiance, this place isn't for you. If you are looking for fun decor or 50's nostalgia then this place is it. Having found a fancy for haddock (as mentioned in my other fish and chip reviews) I opted for the large portion with chips. and my buddy ordered the a standard cod and chips. Our order came out quite quickly; about 15 minutes or so nice and hot fresh out of the fryer. On first break I noticed that the filet still had the skin on it. For me that's an instant buzkill for the meal because you end up destroying the fish and lose the texture of the crisp skin. Maybe its just me but I prefer the fish without the skin! Holla if you hear me! The other complaint I had was the portion size. I ordered a large haddock and my buddies regular cod was the same size. SMH why did I pay more for less?!? The cod was light and flaky but had a very fishy taste to it. The haddock was noticeably lighter and less flaky than the cod and in my option was the better of the 2. The chips were decent and proper however nothing mind blowing either. Not the worst Fish & Chips but I've had better. I wouldn't recommend if you are a tourist to go out of your way to eat here but it is a decent dining option if you are in the area. If you do plan on eating here be sure to make a reservation via Yelp or Open Table; trust me you'll thanks me later...

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. My large haddock and chips up close and personal
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Front: large haddock & chips. Back: large cod and chips

jKSlmScSX6pUfEAPKhKnWg.text: Take this review with a grain of salt, as I'm an ignorant American with limited fish&chip experience. That being said, it was pretty awesome.The Vibe:A little kitschy with the waitress outfits and getups in the kitchen, but nice options of seating indoors, or takeaway and standing out front. Service was friendly, despite the ever present communication gaps I had in London with our English cousins.  Great people watching outside.The Fish&Chip:One order of the rock, one haddock, and a large order of the fries is MORE than enough for two people. I had mixed feeling about the rock, it was a stronger flavor (fishy some would call it), but the fry on it and the texture was spot on. The haddock was perfectly fried, flaky, and delicious. Also gigantic. A large order of the fries filled the bottom of the two takeaway boxes, giving me the impression they have a heavy hand with the fries no matter the order size. The fries aren't fried hard, they're still pretty light in color but have a really nice flake on the inside. Downside to that is you have to eat them while they're very hot to hot, or they lose the texture. Everything needed a helping of salt, which I assume was standard since it and vinegar are table side, and tartar was extra which was annoying.

NTLobyFQ8UKfdzRX_txJIw.text: I'd heard a lot of good things about Poppies and had been looking forward to eating here for a while but I have to say I was a bit disappointed overall. Poppies gets a bonus point for taking the time to fully fillet the fish as I hate it when there is skin left on and I possibly have to go back to make sure my score is accurate but we'll see.I went for the haddock & chips which definitely was a better choice than the cod and although not cheap the taste was actually pretty good. The fish was flaky, the batter was not too greasy and the chips while not the best I've had in London were a lot better than being disappointing.My biggest issue with the whole meal was the way I felt afterwards. I found that the fish and chips sat incredibly heavy in my stomach and kept repeating which was not good. I didn't feel well for the rest of the day and as I'd only eaten breakfast before this the only culprit I can see is the haddock. I'll give it another go just in case but for now my view of Poppies is slightly tarnished

STT1_BGO9prXQMqSLjJKhQ.text: Fish and chips is the quintessential British meal. So when a restaurant in London's East End has fish and chips in their name, you would hope that they know what they're doing.And Poppie's does. On an overcast Sunday (does the sun never shine in this country?), Poppie's was chock full of people with every table full and a short queue ("line" in American) of people waiting to be seated. So instead of waiting, I opted for a takeaway. A nice sized portion for well less than £10, served in the traditional newspaper, it was a great portion of light and fluffy cod and a good number of what looked like hand cut chips. I managed to pour a few shakes of vinegar in there as well to get the full treat.Okay, so the newspaper thing. It turns out that the "authorities" no longer allow real newspaper to be used for wrapping food. Something to do with the ink leaking onto the food. So instead, restaurants have been using a fake newspaper that's printed with ink on it that doesn't bleed onto the food. Traditional, but modernized for your safety!The only downside is that there aren't many places nearby where you can grab a seat, so I ended up leaning against the wall and under an overhang to stay out of the rain.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Poppie's in the rain

sP-i0cCrkiHEhXOSIpnc0A.text: We ate @ poppies of spitalfields, next to the old spitalfields market, for lunch.There were a lot of people but the service was very fast.We ordered cod and fries, delicious, very tasteful and big portions!Fried at the moment and so very hot.Outside the poppies there are two or three benches where you can stay to eat.

3hT_4xFzt3psCW6-0tptiQ.text: We were recommended here by some locals and it was definitely worth the walk from the rail station! It was very busy when we arrived but we were seated within 5 minutes. I looked around and everyone was getting the classic cod and chips so I did as well. The fish n chips came out very quickly and tasted great. The server only came by once when we asked her for more ketchup, but was very busy so if you're looking for a relaxed dinner this is not the place for you.

nCCq4OTC22M1oJjwdstGBA.text: During our trip to London we decided to stick to the well-known foods ... Indian food, meat pies, and fish and chips. We opted for Poppies to get the fish.The setup is like a kitschy diner. It reminded me of Johnny Rocket's, and when we walked inside I was a little worried that we'd fallen into a tourist trap. It very well may be, for all I know, but I remembered that Katz's Deli in New York gets a ton of tourists and it's still really really good.We were seated quickly at a tiny tight table in the back. The waitress hurriedly took our order and was back in minutes with the food. Maybe it's cooked ahead of time to save time, but it must go fast because it was still fresh and crispy. We got haddock and cod so we could sample both. The regular size was MORE than enough. Tartar sauce was good as were the chips.The decor is cute, but again, kitschy. Very loud (but good) oldies music. The waitresses were nice but clearly wanted to turn tables over fast (which is good, I guess, because the place was packed and people kept coming in).Tasty food, polite and nice staff, decent prices, but not a relaxed atmosphere. Go here to say you were here, not to have a leisurely meal.

8kTRNiErA9x9SuyrO7YSSQ.text: Despite some mixed reviews, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal! Came to Poppie's to have some fish and chips and was not disappointed. I ordered the regular size cod with chips. Our orders came out quickly and piping hot. The fish was cooked very well--crispy crunchy on the outside and steaming hot on the inside. It tasted fresh as well. I sampled some of the haddock from a cousin's plate, and I think I actually enjoyed the haddock a bit more. The haddock was less meaty but I personally thought it had better flavor. Both are still good in my opinion! Also, if you're not into fish, Poppie's also has roast chicken and sausages. Definitely worth trying if you're looking for classic fish and chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. regular cod and chips

THKbyiJ7OLnQsrF-mMqVdA.text: Delicious fish and chips with the best staff. Got the haddock and the cod fish and chips and they were both good! Haddock has more fish flavour so it was our favourite. Crisp is thinner than what I'm used to so there's more fish in every bite. A very touristy place to eat yet the staff were so friendly. There was a 10 min wait to get seated and the host assured me ever so often I'd be seated soon. Everyone was so friendly and always smiling. Never tried ginger beer before so thought we'd give it a try and ended up liking it so much we ordered another. Overall very pleasant experience with great service. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Left: haddock, Right: Cod

0rqT28XHGK1H4JLRyIANYw.text: Pretty good but not the best by a long shot. I was excited to try "the best fish and chips in London" and left feeling cheated. I've had way better fish and chips at diners and bars in America. Ketchup lovers beware: they are stingy with Ketchup; it's served in little bottles good enough for maybe 3 or 4 chips. I had to ask my waiter 4+ times for more since it served in such a small portion. Still, the meal was not bad, the portions were good, the atmosphere is fun. I would recommend it just for the experience.

L3fPijzctUECoUSGaUw3TQ.text: Amazing Food!!!! I had to come twice while visiting London on vacation. I was on my way to another restaurant and saw the long line, and inquired, looked at the Menu and I was hooked. Fish cooked just right, and they represented the Brits well with the famous "Fish and Chips." I surely wasn't disappointed, and will be back on my next visit. 1st time I had the cod; this time the haddock and calamari. Next time I will try the Halibut. The host Lauren and my server Tanyeli added the icing to the cake with their pleasing personality. Thanks Folks.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

JKgYw5rw150f4Zf4z0kyTA.text: Very nice piece of fried fish. Yelp and many other lists recommend Poppies as one of the best Fish and Chips places in London. It did not disappoint. The restaurant has diner atmosphere and casual, friendly service. I went for the 'regular' size traditional cod with a side of mushy peas and a lager. If that was the regular then the large must be meant to be shared. The fish itself was perfectly fried. Very flavorful, juicy, with a light, crisp batter and not oily. Definitely one of the best pieces of fried fish I have tried. The chips were just ok. They tasted like homemade fries. Probably just fried once since they were not super crispy on the outside. I found the fish tasted better with malt vinegar or tartar sauce than with lemon, so don't squeeze it all over till you try it separately first. The mushy peas... well... they tasted exactly like what you expect. I like peas, but these must be British kids nightmare food. I don't know what the point of mushing them is. They were just bland, mushed peas. I rescued them a bit by adding a good amount of salt and pepper (which definitely helped). Maybe you're supposed to add S&P, I dunno. By the way, judge me if you want, but I like the option to order half pints. Sometimes you want beer with your food, but don't want to be too full so early. Great for a casual, quick, and filling lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips, Mushy Peas, Beer

Ges4Ndm5TvW2Ys4-3sDuWw.text: Been wanting sticky toffee pudding since I landed in London... and I finally get to have it! This place was super busy. Just insane & there was no way to get a seat BUT I saw there were a few flip chairs outside... that'll work! I ordered the sticky toffee pudding to go.. or as they say, for takeaway. Got it fast & was excited to finally have this beautiful treat.. and woah it did not disappoint!!! It was so so sooooo good! Ideally I would've wanted to be in re restaurant & get the full experience.. was a small place. Oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee puffing with ice cream... so good!
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

H2_EX_cDRjvHT1utmUkFCQ.text: Landing in London, the two things that I wanted to eat the most was: Fish and Chips and a full English breakfast. However, I was pretty disappointed after eating at this establishment. Despite the high ratings of this place, the food here did not leave me wanting more; it also did not amaze me in any way, shape, or form. We came here around 8:00 PM on a Friday night and it was not particularly crowded or anything. We were seated right away and immediately knew what we wanted to eat--my brother and I both ordered the Fish and Chips (Haddock or Cod--I do not know as we did not specify) and two cream sodas. Just an FYI, they have a bunch of other things as well like Steak Pies! The food came out pretty fast and I was initially excited when I saw the dish; however, upon eating the fish it did not stand out to any of the other Fish & Chips that I have had in the United States. The fries were unsalted (thank god so I can choose how much to put) were soggy and probably one of the most fries I have ever eaten. It literally tasted like the thick cut fries that my parents get at the grocery store.The fish tasted really fresh and while I have never had Fish & Chips with the skin still on, it was not bad. The biggest issue for me despite using the vinegar and salt was the lack of or lack thereof the tater sauce and ketchup. They literally only give you a table spoon of ketchup and tater sauce and the fish was super hard to eat without the aforementioned. It just felt super greasy and starchy (from the potatoes). I definitely felt full at the end of the meal, but I also felt super bloated from the grease. Like I said, more tater sauce and ketchup would have helped. All and all, it was a disappointing first meal in London. I would not recommend going here but the locals say this place is bomb so I suggest you trying it for yourself. Service was typical; a 12.5% service fee is added automatically like at most other U.K. spots so you don't really need to tip again unless you feel the need to. I feel like you can get fish and chips anywhere out here so I would suggest looking around.

Azls3rO0rVxDC_gEtwr55w.text: THE original Poppies! After all of the times we had tried fish and chips in pubs, my girlfriend and I gave Poppies a visit during our vacation. We heard it was the real deal and supposedly some of the best fish and chips in all of London so the expectations were already sky high before we arrived.We came here on a Saturday evening at about 8:30pm and, as expected, it was a PACKED house! We had to wait in line, but luckily we only waited about 10 minutes before we got a table in the crammed back area. The restaurant was already small as it was, with tables literally on top of each other, but the back was even more crammed if you could believe it. Throughout the evening we felt the service was blah. We weren't paid much attention to and, unfortunately, the waitresses weren't the nicest folks.There wasn't much of a greeting, you're welcome or have a good evening when we left. The one good thing about the service was that our food came to our table fast, however it was probably because the fish was pre-fried and sitting, waiting to be served already. How did we assume that? Because we saw that they chefs were storing fried fishes in a small containment area that kept them warm at the counter.We both ended up ordering the Regular Haddock Fish & Chips because, frankly, the Large seemed inhumane to try to finish as we witnessed a Large served to another courageous customer. To be honest, I don't think they won that battle. With all of the hype that Poppies had going for it, we expected a lot better. The Haddock was just average to us. It didn't have much flavor to it and was a bit bland tasting. It was fried really well though and kept it's form despite our dousing of it with vinegar. The Haddock also came with a SHIP LOAD of chips, which was the most we received from any pub or restaurant serving fish and chips. Also, there was the ketchup and tartar sauce were served in small little jars, which was a nice touch presentation-wise.Also, a few tidbits about the restaurant. Since it was small, confined and the kitchen shared its space with the dining area it was EXTREMELY hot inside the restaurant. There wasn't much ventilation inside, which made for an uncomfortable experience. In addition, prior to sitting, we noticed that there was actually a significant price difference between eating in and take-out, which we found odd. We could only attribute the price difference to service fees/tips, but that we didn't know for sure. With all of the good to pretty good reviews, we definitely expected a lot more out of the fish and chips, but it just rather pedestrian.

SNFRQk8PEFOKQMDIdXSc2g.text: This is not like fish and chips in the U.S.  more emphasis on the fish and less on the batter. I tried both the Cod and Haddock. Similar I'm taste in my opinion. Preferred the Haddock. Very good. Worth the trip out of the way.

4AeS3H5AsDcWy3qXrvW1rA.text: If you have a smaller appetite, I would recommend getting the kids meal, cod bites and chips, it was a decent size and I would not have been able to finish the adult size.  The fish and chips were pretty good, I had fresher and better fish and chips at the Tail End in St. Andrews, Scotland, but Poppies wasn't bad. I give 5 stars for the sticky toffee pudding and ice cream... so good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Sticky Toffee Pudding and Ice Cream, so good!
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Kids size  Cod Bites and Chips

BSNL-ZZpVoesPNGOMR19Bg.text: I couldn't leave London without trying there fish and chips so I yelped the nearest fish spot and Poppies came up. The decor has a retro feel with a huge jukebox mounted on the wall when you walk in. All the servers were nice and wearing overalls so you feel like you stepped into a time machine but not in a bad way. The waitresses and staff were all really nice and warm. As for the food, I got the regular fish (haddock) and chips and although i liked it, in my mind I thought it would be more seasoned. Maybe if the batter had more seasoning and flavor i could have bumped it up to a 5 star review. Overall I felt it was a no frills traditional fried fish and chips but I will say I was expecting more since I always thought it was a British staple. Good portion sizes though!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Haddock

TNDrob275TgmuFo7wkYbLQ.text: All the food was great here. Had fish and chips (both types of fish). The server was pleased and amused that us Texans got the mushy peas and actually liked them. I thought they were great! We didn't have to wait long to eat inside, but I was glad we did! The inside was a fun experience. It was very old school (in America I'd call it 50s inspired?) with tons of fun stuff on the walls. If you're craving a fish and chips experience, I'd recommend. It was on par with the other fish and chips spots I went, except I was missing hot curry sauce from another place I went in Manchester!

k0GQ_8xOf2X1IGZi2nR91g.text: Overpriced in my opinion. Also the fish was really oily and salty. I'm not sure why this is such a popular place

iBnmvjgNL-2NJkhcX4su0g.text: so far, the best fish and chips place i've found in london. fish was well prepared, with a good crisp on the outside, and flaky moist flesh on the inside. i also ordered a poppies house beer, which was a nice light ale that paired well with the fish. that said, i don't think this compares to many of the best fish and chips joints in the US. Barbara's Fish Trap in California still holds top ranking of best fish and chips of all time. all the same, I would recommend poppies as eating fish and chips in london is one of those checklist items for tourists. check.

Xr75AhiyyzNiQeI3KEx5Kg.text: This was my first fish and chips experience in London and it didn't disappoint. It was simple and to the point, they specialize in fish and chips and my plate was delicious. The restaurant itself is pretty cramped and from what I head can get pretty packed but the good food and customer service made up for it. I definitely recommend anyone in the area to check this place out for fish and chips and I'm sure their other menu items are good as well!

vgV_CGcw0aZ4kU2dGVCaxw.text: You know how people say Britain has no cuisine? It's because they eat places like this. The fish is undeniably fresh, but ruined by under-crisped, under-salted batter and chips. I was halfway to completely pissed and this didn't even taste good. Go to Kerbisher instead.

FlRisQ0bAX46JUizlubVcw.text: Poppies was highly recommended so took my brother who is visiting from Australia for British Fish and Chip. And it didn't disappoint. The service was very prompt and we were seated immediately with menus. We ordered the Traditional F&C and swapped out one of the chips for salad and shared which was brilliant. When we didn't want drinks were offered tap water (which I think is 5star service)We both enjoyed our meals, fish was crispy on the outside and soft+flakey on the inside. Massive serving of thick cut chips (so glad we shared) and plenty of condiments to choose from.

Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. COD and chips

r6d6pThL0EyoNby29fvwwA.text: After a day of walking, I was starved and bummed that I couldn't find a place around Spitalfields open that looked good. Then I saw a activity across a street up ahead and started walking.Turns out I walk into Fish and Chips Heaven. After a very short wait due to the late time, I got a seat against the wall with a nice view of everything.Looking through the menu I got the small plate of Cod with Chips and side of peas and a local Beer.  The Fish was wonderful. Not to greasy, super crisp and it had perfect flavor from being so fresh. I could eat a bowl of their Tartar Sauce. It was lovely.I will be honest and tell you that the chips were a disappointment. They were limp and slightly soggy and not so hot. They tasted ok but nothing like a good chip in Belgium or the Netherlands.They needed to be crisp and hot. I asked for them to fry them a second time on my next visit but they were just as disappointing.The peas were nice and I ate them all, since I needed the veg but it was a big bowl made to share.I thought I was done for the night until I saw Sticky Toffee Pudding on the menu board. It was fantastic. Bring a date just for this treat.I left so happily full I decided I'd be back. Which I did one more time. For the Fish and the pudding.This would be a 5 star place if not for the Chips.

I2letFoJtXICRRHIkgTHqQ.text: OK, Yelpers!!!  These Brits have certainly figured out what good 'fish & chips' are, AND, this is the place to get them!!  Established in 1952, Poppies is a London fav to satisfy the most discriminating 'F&S' connoisseur!  Everything was full of flavor and more than ample to satisfy your hunger craze!Whether you're a local or visiting London, you definitely want to make Poppies one of your stops on the London dining scene!

Nw8653JktwMn4gqfV-24CQ.text: When visiting London, many told us that fish & chips was the food to try. What better place to try that one of their most popular and recommended places: Poppies. Before I got a chance to try Poppies, I had gotten fish & chips at other places in the UK/Europe and was pretty satisfied with what I got. With this in mind, when I finally got to try poppies, I was pretty disappointed. I really didn't feel there was anything special to it. I had better Fish & chips in Europe and I really don't feel like I'd go back to a Poppies. I got the cod and a haddock and if I had to make a choice, I would go with the cod.

IyuV1PyXTSGz2Bci4VJ0-w.text: A little cramped but the food definitely makes up for it.  My fish, chips, and peas came extremely quickly and were all delicious.  The atmosphere is an old style shake shack and the servers are dressed as such.  Overall, cool place and good food.

y7V7aX3hMyV-w64CItfehQ.text: Wanted to like it...wasn't too impressed.  Chips were floppy soggy pale.  Calamari seemed pale...should have been cooked longer.  batter under seasoned.  Seemed a bit pricey for what it was. Probably won't go back.

jjChQm1KtgstZDQucji3uQ.text: Really great fish & chips!  The fish was fresh, the batter was cunchy, and the portions were large.  The decor and service were very 50's American - pretty cool.  The establishment was very clean which is impressive given the open kitchen where hundreds of pounds od fish and chips get fried everyday!

d77zuogG4QdyXCQqIzJ7Xw.text: Yum.  Solid Fish & Chips place. Not stingy with their mushy peas either. And, don't forget the stick toffee pudding.

mfMNn7n3qYwTTVcIBorp0Q.text: Large fish is truly large and I couldnt move for the rest of the day. Regular portions are still large enough! The best Fish&Chips I've ever tried.

64L9nsjVO5mvqVS8fc09fg.text: I had a sausage and chips in here with my Ma and it was rather pleasant. Fish looked good too but I felt like having a true regression meal of sausage, chips and a coke. We also ordered some curry sauce. Being a northerner by blood I do like my curry sauce, but my goodness this was awful. Chip shop curry sauce is meant to be tacky but the only places who seem to get it right are Chinese fish and chip shops. Still everything else we had was lovely. Service friendly and I did like that people were dressed in a retro way. For this area it's nice to have a proper chippy that gives you massive portions and a good healthy dose of nostalgia in every bite. But in a southern way. They can't get the curry sauce right.

OBdR_v8XF8QaPzT7xSGE8Q.text: This place is awful. The staff are rude and obnoxious. Save your money, there are better fish and chip shops in London.

lZJwrgUqwqHoIvQ9eEn3ng.text: Poppies is a great spot for your typical fish and chips, and comfort food. Love the old-fashion, diner type atmosphere. Great staff, and an all around happy place. A good price for the amount of food you get, and a great beer selection!

-mmo8lWASJllhx4a0SEt0Q.text: Yummy yummy fish and chippy in my tummy! The 50/60's style decour and the music playing in the background really blew me away...what an amazing way to dine at a fish and chips shop! Oh I do love their fish and chips *droolssssssss* top quality mate!

XTXt7Mp9qmqIzblil25Nww.text: Very good fish and chips! Unfortunately I came too late and a few of the other choices of fish were gone because they had a busy day. Either way I thought this place was very good and would definitely come back next time I'm in London.

hYq3TMI2MN93JRn-VMCB2Q.text: Great Fish and Chips! We enjoyed the "poppish" atmosphere and the fish was good too. Even though the fries were fresh, they were just average to us and that's why the 4 stars. Service was impeccable.

SQ4lbGzWnUEJL1hv5FtNOQ.text: Takeaway very efficient, staff very kindly and fish fresh and not too oily. Excellent

zC0fORCifWYjyiJ-pcIThg.text: The cutest little Fish and Chips shop around. I go here when I need a quick, affordable DELICIOUS bite to eat. The atmosphere is perfect, just what I am looking for in a restaurant such as this. Fish and chips is one of my favorite meals, and this has become my new favorite place to get it. T5m3aJVtYotZ7MCfbih5Bg.text: Basic but oh so delicious fish and chips! I shared a huge plate with the Mister but really wish I had my own. ZDkSCEjVuKY7_Ayhggz9bg.text: Poppy's goes toe-to-toe with Golden Hind for best fish and chips in London.  The fish is fresh, the batter light and chips perfectly fried.

42JooECSDhMKXgmn8Ep_vQ.text: What a cute place!  The food was really great.  We had a lot of fish n chips at several restaurants while in London, but this was the best.  The portions are really huge (think typical American portions).  Everything was excellent (cod, haddock, mushy peas, beans, etc. etc.), the service was good, and don't forget to save some room for sticky toffee pudding!

xbytDaalQ0LB3A67htw_Fg.text: Fab looking interior with '50s stylee waitresses. However, as the place is new I think they are still sorting out their processes....chips were undercooked and fish was good but not great. Staff were nice, hope they get it together!

GpbifM2SaPwvNnc-6HP3Hg.text: Accidentally we passed the restaurant and thoughtlet's have some F&C. There was a little queue, but we were quickly seated. The food was great, I had a grilled codfish and homemade chips. I loved the interior designgood taste :-).Service was helpful and quick.We will be back.

y8sZdB3iz2EsObCGc4xW1g.text: OMCod!  This was the best fish & chips I've ever had! . . . also enjoyed the mushy peas, and sticky toffee pudding!

zO3sOuQkiVXaw6Dqp4N6nw.text: It is a great and perfectplace to grab a delicious fish and chips. It will lightly breaded, flaky, andfull of flavour. Really crispy and not so greasy. They also offer variety ofclassic drinks and side dish. The place is really good to grab some quick takeaway foods.

WHwAg6OtNP5lq0huzjxn9g.text: Loved it. First time having fish & chips in the UK. I loved the malt vinegar & salt on the chips/fries instead of ketchup. It was good on the fish, too, which was super fresh & fried perfectly with the skin. I prefer crunchy chips but I believe it's standard that they are more potato-ey/not crunchy. I went twice. One large order of fish & a side of fries in one container is enough for two. The beef pie is pretty good, too. I like the flaky crust. I'd def come, again.

IhZEEiaKr0g0xbs_0i1uEg.text: One of the most renowned places in london for fish and chips. The atmosphere is amazing if you are a 50s lover like me: awesome music (last time, aretha Franklin), 50s memorabilia on the walls and waitress dressed like the cafe in back to the future 2!But more important (well, that's not true, let's say as important as) than the place, the food. First time you come here, you already know what to have: fish n chips, regular. The cod is perfectly cooked, moist and compact, nicely fried (crispy and not greasy). Wonderful! Chips are good, they are bigger than usual size (as I prefer) and perfectly fried. I'm actually wondering about how they manage to have such a perfect fried food, it's amazing!Ah btw, portions are generous! It's not that cheap, but I can tell you, one dish is more than enough and you won't regret the expense! Only one defect: beers are not that good and they are a bit expensive, but you are going there for food not to drink, right!?!In conclusion, definitely suggested, it's totally worth the money and the waiting time (yes, be prepared to wait a bit as it seems to be crowded every day at every tine!), just enjoy your 50s hideout! !

5uj65s29cUnY7XSqUfTDWw.text: Food was delicious. The fish and chips were the tastiest I had in London. Great service. The servers kept our drinks full. We were a group of 11 or so. The live music on Saturday night was fantastic.
