EaK7QbSwpjpV_631QQTDAw.text: Great decor with music to match. Setting up the table took a little longer than expected and they said they didn't have the technology to split the bill, but otherwise, the service was good.The fish & chips were great. Haven't had such good ones in a long time. You get a really big piece of fish, which is cooked to a nice flakiness. The batter is nice and cripsy. The chips tasted fresh and were also crispy. Like the tartar sauce as well.I would definitely go again.

rWAAi5glMoJe8qEqFC9OWA.text: I went here with a friend, based off of a recommendation from my hotel's concierge, and was pretty satisfied.  The atmosphere is nice enough, as was the service...it's very 50s style  The fish & chips were pretty solid as well.  While in London, this was definitely one of the better meals that I had.  I would return again.

IR7xh1J8AeqAp34cw9Hgrw.text: Definitely the best fish and chips I had on this trip.  And the atmosphere is truly amazing. 50s style diner, wait staff that look like they belong in the 50's and even an old jukebox!

fcK26xsGXqaIA2AdiJgxUg.text: My boyfriend really wanted to have authentic fish & chips while in London and with Poppies great reviews and it's convenient location to where we were staying and sightseeing (right in the middle of Spitalfields markets!!), it was the obvious choice. They have an excellent selection of fish and the ambiance is adorables...like a diner from the 50's. The waitstaff could be a tad bit friendlier though :-) I'd recommend and return nontheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

YTFjWn4o9vwhz3Azq2uPnQ.text: Tried the cod and haddock. Both were excellent! The cod allows you to taste more of the malt vinegar and tatar sauce while the haddock is more of a nice white flaky fish. Can't decide which was better. The service was excellent. All the servers were extremely attentive. Had to try the mushy peas and a fish cake and both were just ok. Would definitely recommend this place!

bsE6G4lLdCfy1CZUihQePQ.text: Love the 50's style of the place. It's a real fish and chips restaurant with Retro styling. Clean, brightly lit and fun. Great service too.Cod and chips was very good and nicely presented. My guests also sampled rock fish and haddock. All good. Beer, wine and soft drinks available. Tap water on request (plus points for that).4 stars overall for ambience, good food, reasonable value.

qM6qzK4zCO9d02IUOAT5ww.text: Every time we come here the service is amazing and the food is just the best. Every customer that leave is smiling and every customers that comes back is reconsied. Well we are.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

MlfT4KpQzSut-D1z5B0VQg.text: I just wanted the chips and a beer. Thank goodness we got there before the rush.  This place was packed and had a queue outside in the rain once lunchtime started. The chips were good and apparently the fish was really good. The portions were big. The retro signs will have you busy looking around in wonder. Great place for a boring blind date I suppose :) plenty to look at if you realize you're not interested in what he/she is saying.

-x7bBe38e2JwzOL_Xy6VUw.text: Great plate of fish and chips for 10GBP.  Ordered the cod and it came out hot and crispy.  The cut of fish was about an inch thick, so it really held the moisture.  It is pretty rare to find a juicy yet crispy fried fish.  this place delivered.  So good,  The chips where thick cut and crunchy.  To top it off, the tartar sauce was homemade.  What more can you ask for?  The service is good and fast and the place is really clean.  If you really want the newspaper treatment, the take out window serves the fish in faux newspaper (not legal to use real newspaper).  It doesnt have the pub vibe, so cant give it the full 5 star treatment, but a really good plate of fish and chips.

aGdnAbw1G61qxbUUdOU3YQ.text: Nice decor if you are into the retro thing and can't fault the service or anything. Just feel that it is quite overrated and overly priced but maybe that's to pay for the decor. Happy days near by is just as good

GNu9oU2z9ewFfpPD8-IU_w.text: I think Poppies is a place that proves to Northerners that people in London know nothing about fish and chips.Having lived in quite a few places over the last ten years I can tell you that this place is nothing special. It serves up a decent fish and chips. Not great by any stretch. You have to take into consideration where this place is, round Brick Lane/ Shorteditch. Anything vaguely retro or ironic and everybody's thundering on about how amazing it is. My response is, you can't eat the decor.So to the food! The extortionate, over-hyped but woefully underwhelming food. If you want a fish and chips you'll be looking at around £10-£15. I've lived in Newcastle where the fish is freshly landed just hours ago, they're making everything there and then in the kitchen and it has come to about a third of the price of this and tasted so much better. (Probably because they weren't throwing your money at twee faux-vintage junk for the walls)The fish was tough on the inside and the batter was oily, probably due to being in the fryer too long at too low a temperature. The chips were undercooked- it seemed like the whole order had been rushed through to get people in and out as fast as possible. Joking about how if this was a chippy, where was the gravy, the manager/ owner gruffly told me that this was a traditional sort of restaurant and that he made the best chips in London. Firstly, there was curry sauce on the menu but no gravy, not sure how that's traditional but whatever. Secondly he was a grumpy sod as soon as people had anything but compliments or cash for him and lastly, NO. These were not the best chips in London. If, as he claims, he's spent his life doing this I can only imagine that a lifetime of grease fumes have gummed up his neural pathways. They weren't even the best chips on that street. I'd normally give this three stars for just being an average nothing-to-write-home-about fish and chip restaurant but the fact it rates itself so highly just because there's nothing similar in the area and therefore no competition brings it down. It's complacent, lackluster and hoping that the pictures on the walls distract you from this. There's nowhere else that does fish and chips nearby so it'll do in a fix and if you're feeling flush. I'd be embarrassed to take any of my non-London friends or family here.

Mv3BlvfcjEouc53vPmoXxA.text: Yelp has never steered me so wrong. Maybe this place bought all its reviews? It's like a bad 50s diner inside and the whole staff is wearing costumes and scowls. We had haddock and it was worse than fish sticks from the freezer. The chips were soggy and bland. Seems like a tourist trap. Totally don't get why this place is highly ranked, and wish I hadn't gone here.

16-i6NDft_xEvfuWNMBw-g.text: I have only had two fish and chips in London, one was at a bar by southbank. That was terrible compared to Poppies fish and chips. Crispy, awesome breading on top of the fish, you can eat that thing alone. The fish was fresh and delicious. The chips were awesome and chunky as well, but not too fat, it tasted great. The vinegar was not too sour like most vinegars, it was perfect for the fish and chips. Gosh, I just want some more now that I am thinking about it. Crunch crunch.

hWqdLBf9tXgxE5jxvpNV5w.text: Good food and service. I'm not really a fish and chip person, but I thought it was decent - better than I expected. The salad was great.

gisUrdlpOmFrVi1Br8FCoQ.text: Their cod and chips are amazing! I would also try the sticky toffee pudding.

77uwLuCXh6VQMYh9V-dVpg.text: This was our first fish and chips place! It was amazing! Very fresh and delicious! Service was quick and although it was a tiny place, we felt comfortable and was sat right away! Definitely would go back and recommend this place!

WprtUt_b1NUXmtV_-s7HyQ.text: Ok, so I'm never going to eat Fish and Chips anywhere else again. I came here on some random night (Thursday?) and it was totally packed. Who cares, I resigned myself to waiting. I only had to wait 15 minutes until a table in the back opened up. Cool. Also, if you don't want to wait, they have takeaway and possibly delivery. I wouldn't risk delivery though.  I ordered the regular cod and chips, and my god was it amazing. The batter, the freshness of the fish, and the sogginess of some of the chips and the crunchiness of others... everything was spectacular and has completely ruined it for me forever. This is going to be one of those places where now "it's good but not as good as Poppies" will be a phrase used later to describe food from competitors.

a87vgsPW-yobHWYubeXvzA.text: This place gets busy! Good thing it has two floors. You can tell right when you walk in that this is a neighborhood hotspot, even at 11 o'clock at night!It's mandatory to get fish and chips when one visits England, and this was the handiest place to go for me. Thankfully, it's open late. With all the people crammed in the restaurant, it does get very loud. I was having a hard time listening to my friends at our table. Service was speedy, however. The cook on the fish and chips was excellent, though I can't say I was blown away by the flavors or quality. I appreciated the single-serving ketchup and tartar sauce, but I think I would have preferred a regular-sized bottle of the ketchup for the chips.Overall, this place was decent, and I don't regret going. The food just wasn't too memorable for me and the restaurant was a bit close quarters for my taste, which made it feel overcrowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

IFJCAAKzTsPlvH1m2BkSjg.text: We got the cod and haddock to have a variety and it was simply alright. The cod is definitely the better choice if you want a meatier fish. The haddock is very crisp with a lot of batter and not much meat.The chips are just plain fries. I don't like the fact that they charge you for any type of sauce. Whether it's tartare or ketchup, they charge you !!! This place is way overhyped, but we had to try it cause it is award winning. Trust me, there are better fish & chips places in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips

AIRH9MSE7PyAr2iTIbdeug.text: Love the decor of the restaurant. I was drawn to Poppies because of the popular yelp ratings and eating fish and chips seemed like the thing to do when visiting London. I had the regular sized fish and chips - the waitress said the haddock would be fishier so I opted for the cod. What can I say? Fish and chips are fish and chips. It's hard to mess up anything fried. The fish was fried nicely and I enjoyed it more than the chips. I'm personally a fan of thin fries so that's probably why. Soon after, a group of tourists came in for lunch too. This is definitely a popular tourist attraction. Overall, I didn't think Poppies was mind-blowing, but it's definitely a decent spot if you're craving some fish and chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

22Zohegf5F9StfikVZyKcw.text: My last day in London and I wanted to eat Sticky Toffee pudding before I leave. This was the only place that seemed to have it that was also close by. I didn't actually dine in here, so can't comment about the place as such. Ordered through uber-eats, chicken pie and the pudding.Loved the pudding, would definitely recommend it for anyone who loves sticky toffee pudding. Chicken pie was alright, nothing to rave about.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Chicken pie with chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding with ice cream

qpRXByq-wnZKhWkD-osp5A.text: Great, traditional restaurant that serves fish and chips. The restaurant offers things other than fish and chips but this is what they are most known for hence why we came.You are given a choice between cod or haddock. I got the haddock and my husband ordered the cod. I prefer the haddock since the fish is a bit lighter and less "chewy" opposed to cod. My only gripe is that the fish is breaded and cooked with the skin on which I would have preferred the skin removed. Instead I just ate the top and left the skin on the plate. *I'm not sure if the restaurant gives you the option to have the skin removed.*We both ordered a side of mushy peas which was quite large. We would have been fine sharing one between the two of us.

-UDSGanqMqB0sqkGkYaJPg.text: Good food. A bit pricey for fish and chips...I loved the 1950's type vibe here and the staff was very pleasant. The food was good but not amazing and shouldn't have been as expensive as it was. I think we were paying for the kitsch of it rather than the quality of the food.

EFsgMtnf3OpyEaqUtCMThg.text: Great little fish and chips shop with a lot of traditional British food. I got the cod and chips for takeaway. They have salt and vinegar outside for those who get takeaway. The cod was great and flakey, which was way better than the chips which were a little soggy and tasteless. Portions were great. They give you a ton of chips- I don't think anyone finishes them in one sitting. The salt and vinegar definitely helped though, so be sure to make good use of them!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

P97YNF0sOsR61Lwe9Oc0oA.text: Okay, this place offers the best fish and chips I've ever encountered! (Closest thing to heaven) I came here while visiting London and will come back to London simply for these fish and chips. I ordered Cod and it was incredibly fresh and tasty. Nothing seemed overly fried or seasoned. With the fish and chips came a hefty wedge of lemon and the added zest was perfect. If in London, you have to go to this glorious institution.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

NiXKRPetcps0OCEY0_oCWw.text: Yummy fish and chips!Coming to London on a vacation, we knew we had to try the fish and chips. After doing some online research, Poppie's seemed like a reliable and well-liked option, so we decided to give it a shot.We ordered a large halibut with chips and a fried seafood sampler. Both were delicious! The fish was perfectly battered and fried to a golden brown, with a generous side of chips. The seafood sampler came with cod bites, calamari, anchovies, and shrimp. My only complaint was there was only 1 piece of shrimp-- very measly, too. But everything tasted good and the prices were affordable, so I won't complain too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fried seafood sampler

JpownSTw49yCeKp5ZIzObA.text: Old SchoolPoppies Fish & Chips is an old school, classic diner. It was a 10-15 minute walk from the downtown core. For the authentic fish and chip taste, it's where everyone recommends so I had to try it out. It was quite busy on a weekday evening. You had to wait for a table. Takeout is available.There's a variety of fish and chips meals. I tried the cod and chips for £12.20 ... and added calamari rings starter. Everything tasted fresh. But it was a bit too fried/oily for me.I'd still recommend checking it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

1eWy9G9XWGhbpjNJ7hOkDg.text: Fish & Chips and cool vibes, This was recommended by several locals to stop in for fish and chips which we did. I ordered the large and well my eyes were bigger than my stomach. The large is a healthy portion so I would advise to get only if you are really hungry. The cod was great and had good flavor. The chips were a bit soft for my liking but all in all good flavor. Service was great. We were the first ones seated in the back room and the space filled up within ten minutes of being there. One annoyance was that my dad was sitting at the head of the table which was near the entry and kept having to pull his chair in each time a guest passed. It would have been nice to put at a large table were we weren't in the way. It took away from the food experience. The decor is cool and it was fun to read all the different posters and pictures on the walls.

t5iibja7Pe7vY1P2_aCTSQ.text: Alert! Alert! Delicious fish and chips served here!! Very easy place to find, clear pricing and food on offer. A bit on the expensive side for a chippie but the food is delicious and this is not your standard fish and chips place. The decor is great, people working here are welcoming, not intrusive and very effective. The food is cooked fresh and there is a lot more on offer than just fish and chips. Portions are ginormous so don't hesitate to share with a friend if you want to try one of their delicious desserts!

v8Um_FXpjgIs2TBXJXhRug.text: Take away experienceBrought a halibut with chips to go, total comes to 14.50 (11.90 for the fish, 2.30 for the fresh cut chips and 30p for a pack of tartar sauce).This is one of the best fish and chips I have ever had and the portion was good for a big guy like me.For ladies, it would be a good idea to share with another person.

vuCis6XUlekPc8r1oS7Jlg.text: Great place to come. I've been here years ago and loved it This latest time was after I developed a gluten allergy. I would NOT recommend if you have a gluten allergery as the cross contamination is high.  Shared friers, and for resting against each other with the fried foods. I order the gluten free rotisserie chicken and still felt it. Normally I can eat foods in a shared environment but wasn't possible here. The -1 star was was only because the chicken was dry and bland. But 5 stars based on my non allergy experience

Atwv2WIdCW_Rn8YwYk4IFA.text: It was delicious. Generous portion sizes, for sure. Great place to grab a late dinner. Also the atmosphere is very 1950's diner which was really cute, just hard to hear the wait staff.

F9hEl4MrH9Y_dDD7pOAbfw.text: Excellent fish and chips for eat in or take away from the multi-awarded chain restaurant. Nice interiors, quick service and yammi food.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

4IycnOgALBFkF68Q-Mj-zg.text: Fish, what I ordered was standard one, cod with tartar source was really amazing, fresh and crispy. What's better was pricing, inexpensive for the central zone 1, although take away price. Staff was kind and quick service nothing to complain.

Xn71dDfvukkRqhgX7-LjpQ.text: Poppies is very small, very crowded, and VERY BUSY!  This should tell you something.  The fish and chips are quite good.  Nicely seasoned, very fresh, and not at all greasy.  I'ts not as huge a difference as one gets between American soft pretzels and the gems one gets in Munich, but it is better than any fish and chips I've had in the united States.  The portion sizes are HUGE (especially considering the low price).  Please be aware that you'll need to make reservations if you want to dine in and not wait for a long time (which I did from the United States using their web site well in advance of my trip), but even if you don't, it will be worth the wait.  As an American, this was my first time having mushy peas, and they taste exactly like you'd expect them to.  Poppies is also located in close proximity to an Underground station, so getting there is quite easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Regular portion size haddock and chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Mushy peas

luZUH-nRzW3onXHy4VVYtQ.text: Poppies is a fantastic way to have traditional fish and chips without going to one of those gosh-awful touristy places.On our last night in London, the Mister and I really wanted something traditional. Trusty Yelp pointed us to Poppies - and they take reservations, so score for them. When we arrived, the incredibly lovely servers immediately took us to our table by the windows, and the experience was really fantastic.The service was fast and friendly, and the food was delish. They had a local cider too! We had fish and chips and a chicken pie with chips. I'm not a fish and chips connoisseur, but it was light, crispy, and not greasy. Oh, and the sticky toffee pudding we split was gone in about 30 seconds - it was that good.So, if you're near Shoreditch and looking for some good traditional food, head on over to Poppies!

h_wG4k9hT1DvIfHwnAHa1w.text: It is Bomb!! It definitely satisfies that fried crispy craving...This place is probably a Italian owned joint with a decor of an 50's - 60's diner. (American's think Johnny Rockets, Mel's Diner type of place). Bottomline they offer a nice offering of fish.I am a big fan of fish and chips. I tried to get it as often as possibly while roaming the streets of London. Poppies is a fairly cheap place to grub (10 pounds for an order)The fish comes in a big fresh fillet of fish really crispy with a good portion of chips. The fish is moist with a good crunch with the batter, and not over fried or dry. I like how they offer different cuts of fish so a good variety of textures can be indulged to satisfy that guilty pleasure.  TIPS: After the meal, they give you some licorice candy from the "owners" homeland. It is awful. Don't try it. The waitress (a nice British gal) didn't even know what the candy was and she works there..

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

JOSOyQtWmuAApw6bG-4K2w.text: I'll be totally honest - I've never actually had the fish at Poppies, which is odd, considering it's a fish and chips shop. But I seem to only come here when I've already just eaten, or I'm on my way to somewhere else for a meal. However, neither scenario prevents me from walking away with a giant newspaper cone full of steamy starchy chips!Grab some condiments from the salt and malt vinegar shakers chained to the counters just outside and for a mere £2.30, you have enough fried potato to satisfy a party of three or four people with a savoury snack.Between the exceptionally quick service and the reliably good takeaway treat, I always have a problem with passing up Poppies whenever I'm down on Hanbury. I -do- have to stop in one of these days to finally try their fried fish, too... with chips, of course!

th6EHkfTNG4ndP0xrA1jnQ.text: If you go to England and do not try their fish chips, then it's a crime. During my visit to England, I wanted to give my girl-friend a true tasty of British food, and nothing more British than fish and chips. Being from eastern part of India, we love fish (cooked in any form, be sushi, be it curry). I have been to couple of London fish & chips institutions before (Bailey's, Golden Hind) during my previous visits, but this was my first visit to Poppies. Decor is nothing extraordinary, but after we were seated, you do feel that the place is pretty cramped. Now coming to the most important part of the experience, the food. I ordered regular Cod and my girl friend ordered large Haddock. I also ordered side of mushy peas. It was delicious. Fish was moist and full of flavor, the batter was crispy but not heavy. Mushy was good too. Nothing special to add about the chips, regular chips, nothing out of ordinary. Can not say whether this is the best Fish & Chips in London or not, but surly one of the best. Most importantly my girl-friend enjoyed the food, which made the trip even more enjoyable ;)

LlHMVMLsmJVrrOsJwElbbA.text: What could be more British than fish & chips? Despite the fact that it's battered and deep fried and served up with a side of chips that puts the term "Super-size" to shame, you can't help but crave it. And when such a craving strikes, there are few better places than Poppies to go to. Located near Liverpool St, this is going to be my go-to place to line the stomach before a night out. While there is seating, it tends to be quite busy and for fish and chips I don't need more than a place to rest my tray - luckily the outside tables are perfect for this! I opted for the cod on the recommendation of the girl taking my order and I can't say I was disappointed. The massive piece of fish was juicy and flaky and cooked to perfection. The batter managed to stay crispy and dry without giving in to the oiliness that KFC chicken and most chippies' products have in spades. The chips were thick and fluffy with just a hint of crispiness on the outside. While they were tasty and filling, I would have preferred more crunch. I will say that these beasts of potato can absorb a fantastic amount of malt vinegar which just supports my stomach-lining preference.Overall, for less than a tenner you get a delicious filling meal that will keep you going without clogging your arteries. It's hard to ask for much better than that!

WDl3UeNAvMPBvmXRaOX8tw.text: I was a bit disappointed with Poppies. The fish came out oddly fastlike literally immediately after we ordered it. The batter was a tad soggy and the fries were not crispy.

tOWfJz8onoVUtT22loZ8UQ.text: The gold standard of fish and chips. Had the haddock and chips, the hubby had the cos and chips and we shared a side order of the bread and butter. I try to avoid white bread but that bread was the stuff dreams are made of. Fresh, chewy and they use real butter. Made the most excellent chip butty. The fish and chip meals weren't huge so you don't feel like a total glutton. The chips were fluffy and crispy, the batter was crispy and not greasy. My haddock could have tastes fresher (wondering if it was frozen) but it was still tasty. The hubby enjoyed his cod. We both had Yorkshire gold tea to wash it all down and the tea pot and cups stayed lovely and warm throughout the meal. Cute vintage dressed waitresses who are very nice.

f5OiARgMXbRMq1YFjWjdZQ.text: Opening Remarks:-Opened in 1945-Owned by Pop Newland, a British man who's been making fish & chips his entire life.-With the success of their original location in East London, the family opened up a second shop in Camden Town.-They are frequently regarded as the top Fish & Chip parlor in London.-Poppies offers live music Fridays and Saturdays.Ambiance:-Straight out of a scene from a post-war film. The posters on the wall speak to war-time paraphernalia and 50s pinup housewife jokes (so my style). The ceiling is lined with old toys and housewares from the 50s including the tiniest television I have ever seen (then again, nowadays we watch TV on our phones!)-Beside the dining room there is a line up out the door for quick take out. Patrons can take it home or stand around one of the high top tables outside.Service:-Fast, efficient and remarkably friendly - our server asked us how we would like our meal timed (thank you!!!) and if we would like new cutlery and plates between courses.-Servers all dress up in 1950s nautical type dresses - honestly, it's like Poppy's was personally created for me!Drink Menu:-I believe the other location offers booze, but we were already feeling loopy from jet lag so ordered simple with a few Cokes in retro bottles to keep things sober.Menu:-Heavily fish & chip based rounded out with a variety of classic British staples like baked beans and mushy peas.-All fish is sustainably caught and purchased from Peterhead Fisheries.-There are 13 different seafood options for your fish & chip supper.-Take-Away meals are served in newspaper like the good old days.Hand Peeled Prawn Cocktail ( 4.95)We certainly weren't expecting baby shrimp in a Russian-type mayo dressing laying on a mound of iceberg, but it was pretty tasty. My only complaint is that I wished there was some dressing on the lettuce below and a little less on top as it was hard to get an evenly dressed bite.Gherkin ( 1.00)Yum. Mild sweetness and not too sour, a great pickle.Garden Peas ( 2.45)These are you-know-who's favourite food so he was super pleased with this. Simple but effective.Halibut and Chips ( 15.90)I can see what the fuss is about-these were damn good F&Cs. The halibut was so moist, it literally melted like butter on the tongue, while the batter was crispy but light. The chips, while not my personal style of fried potatoes (I like skinnier with skin and more browning), were undeniably fluffy.Cartmel Sticky Toffee Pudding ( 4.60)Months ago (maybe years ago) Carmel tweeted to me all the way from England and I have since wanted to try their famous STP. Well, it was damn good. Not too sweet, but super moist and delicate, I loved the rich molasses flavour of the cake. I wasn't particularly hungry but I ate it all up.Closing Remarks:-Bill for 5 dishes and 2 pops came to 37 including tax and tip ($60 Canadian). Kind of pricey considering what we got and what we would likely pay for this in a fish and chip shop at home-Despite the price, the food and service was great and I loved the nostalgia atmosphere and for that alone I would be back.

D3OMvY08DjqzMBn6e_s71Q.text: Warning: Check that your salt shaker is screwed securely!I ended up dumping the contents of my salt shaker on my fish.  Fortunately, I had just a few bites left (but the last bites are always the ones you savor most!).  Still, good place for late night fish and chips with cute diner decor and solidly yummy mushy peas!  Also, they offer an organic cider which goes perfect with the meal.

Lum6zyTbAc9xg_UdMDitZg.text: Some of the best fish and chips I had in London. In London is key - the further North you go, in my opinion, the better fish and chips you will get.This place has a great atmosphere and some great food. The service was great as well! The people were nice and we got rated right away. I will say that it's quite busy during lunch and dinner, but if you reserve a table or go at an off peak time, you'll get a table. They do have take away, so if it is busy, grab a box and go! The fish and chips is fantastic. The chips are a bit soggy sometimes, but not horrible and don't ruin the food. Also, the peas are good. It is worth mentioning that it is kind of expensive, but it's worth it.

aNjd9HQITKVMdk6m9jwXxw.text: You haven't had fish and chips until you've had poppies. I'm not a huge fish and chips fan but the fish here is awesome. Super tender and moist. You also get a variety of different fish that you can have fried. I had the skate fish which was delicious and you can eat the bones with it. My bro had the cod which was yummy. French fries were just so so. Prolly one of my favorite meals in London.

alEvh7SNITM9s71br2Ambg.text: I had the haddock i was pretty gud , the only problem i had was the tarter sauce it wasnt to good

rsvzhNOKMucZTtDSzsKflQ.text: Very good meal.   I had the Cod fish and chips.   Cooked just right.   The woman I was dining with had steak pie and we shared each others main courses.   The steak pie had an outstanding, flaky pastry crust.   Sticky toffee pudding for desert was quite good as well.    Interesting decor, and servers' uniforms.   Definitely a cut above the average fish and chips place.

VU1W5_C4PP6TVFIibMzCrA.text: The atmosphere and service was nice and the restaurant itself is really quaint and fun. The fish and chips themselves were perfectly edible but not as tasty as you would have hoped. The chips were dry and the other things on the menu aren't particularly exciting.Why don't they do good milkshakes?

qHs-91VVWFphq0EIosaEbw.text: Mmm mmm mm!!  Coming to London, I knew I wanted to stuff my face with fish and chips, glad this was my first place to go.  Even though the place is small, the wait goes by pretty fast.  You can always order to go and Poppies has free seating outdoors - I should have opted for this!  Their fish was juicy and crispy, and even though I saw them take it from their pre made fish that was in heated under a heat lamp, I was surprised how fresh it tasted, not dry at all.  Fries was good, different from what I am used to in America (maybe most similar to In N Out fries??)  What stole the show from their fish and chips plate is their tarter sauce.  It had a hint of capers and had a good consistency.  Unfortunately it seems that Poppies likes to control the consumption of the sauce of their patrons, as they give you a very small jar of it!  I also tried their sticky toffee pudding with ice cream, and mmm that was the cherry on top of a very good classic British meal.  Portions are very generous, and it might be smart to go halfsies on someone. Would definitely come back!

naT6EWIXEzH_UUbdtX4XKw.text: Best fish and chips in UK. Seriously, if you have some one from overseas and you want to show traditional fish and  chips, this is your place.

hYSD4eE5Uowe833xhw1EWA.text: Oh, thank god.I was starting to think that fish and chips were better in Texas than in their homeland!Poppies is SO delicious.  Perfectly crispy, large portions (seriously, don't get the "large" unless you're dying of hunger).  The chips were crisp on the outside and not soggy like I've experienced at other fish and chip joints.I live nowhere near Spitalfields, but if I'm craving fish and chips, I'll trek down to Poppies.PS... they have an AMAZING sticky toffee pudding.

48Vk-pT5BEmO9Y6PDff3Lw.text: Amazing chips shops chips and battered sausage. Exactly what you expect from a traditional chippy. Great value and prices as well and especially considering they are in a prime location.

5qMy-w3lbyUrV8yMVHiGSg.text: Very touristy, but definitely a good place for fish and chips. The haddock is much better than the cod. The waitresses are all dressed up in 50 style make up and clothing.

9Pe431F7gtja45Qu9aKlHA.text: Poppies is such a fun place to grab fish and chips. The decor is so nostalgic and the staff has some pretty cool uniforms. I loved taking out of town friends to Poppies for this reason, and for its delicious food. The fish is also flakey, and I never have a problem with anything being too oily (which seems to be pretty common at other places). They also offer a range of "classic" soft drinks and sides. Although a little pricey, I think that when the whole atmosphere and quality of food are considered, it's worth it. My only complaint would be that sometimes it's quite hard to grab some of the waitstaff's attentions. But other than that it's a fun place to grab some classic fish and chips. Oh, and they have this funny thing where they rope off the dining area from the to-go line. My friends always joke that the host is like a bouncer, because he has to move the rope to let people in.

v2iTGpgw2aw8mLH-VkX3Ow.text: I went here for dinner and had a great time! It was very crowded when I went, but even so, we were seated pretty much immediately. It's a bit crammed, but is a very charming place. The staff are very friendly and efficient. I ordered a large traditional cod fish & chips with a side of mushy peas. The food came out very quickly. I had heard that this was the best fish & chips in London and while I did not believe this to be the case, I still really enjoyed my fish & chips. The fish was fresh and fried pretty well. They were crispy without being super oily. The chips were fresh and crispy on the outside while soft on the inside. The mushy peas were excellent and not overly seasoned. It was a bit pricey because I had other fish & chips in London that were also as good, but more reasonable. Overall, great food, friendly staff and service, a bit pricey, and good location

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Mushy peas
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large cod fish & chips

t4ky-FLc0NbOjyz0Q8J1_Q.text: Best fish in chips 2017?I'm not sure who was drunk giving out awards that day, but I'm pretty sure they are fired now.Ordered the cod fish and chips.   It came out in like 2 minutes with the place almost empty so that was red flag number one.  The batter here is a bit different than average as it looks like they are using panko breadcrumbs.   I thought it might be really good but as we ate, it was not good.   While the batter was a nice golden brown, it did not hold the fish together well at all.  Also, the fish was really overcooked.   The end result was just a mess of dry splintered cod all over the plate.   The chips were average, nothing to write home about. This place seems way more concerned with branding itself and the after bottles, the Tatar bottle, etc, than making the best fish and chips.   I wouldn't repeat.

_hOTtTdh-p3SnSZRGckyyw.text: TIMING:   - Arrived around 5pm on a Tuesday night   - We didn't have to wait but the line picked up around 6pmFOOD:    1. Sparkling water         - I loved their branding touch on everything    2. Chicken and gravy         - Texture: boiled and could've been grilled a little longer         - Seasoning: salted well         - Portion: good for 1. The chicken was very hard to pick apart and there was more bones than there was meat. but the chicken was still juicy overall.    3. Fish (cod) and chips         - Texture: Light and fluffy         - Seasoning: deep-fried and salted well         - Portion: good for 2 people to share    4. Chips         - Texture: soft (2/5 on my crunchy scale)         - Seasoning: light, needed ketchup          - Portion: perfect! can never have too many chipsSERVICE:   - QuickEXTRA:   - Wasn't that filling if we didn't force ourselves to eat all of the chips   - Come before dinner time to avoid the lineWOULD RECOMMEND?   - Sure. I know this is supposed to be the best of the best, but I thought the food was just okay. I would recommend this for people who want to see a family establishment that put hard work into their brand, style, and restaurant name.

Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and gravy and cod fish and chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Sparkling water 1.95

EGvI0W_c5g94DlWBY5UySw.text: What an amazing place to have the classic English dish of Fish and Chips. The restaurant design is old school yet fresh and funky, the food is just what I needed. The traditional cod was cooked with just the right amount of crispiness on the outside and tenderness on the inside. The chips played their role very well providing the needed balance of flavours. No visit to Poppies is ever complete without trying their famous homemade mushy peas, every spoonful was delightful. For dessert I went with another classic - sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice cream. The hot pudding and cold ice cream complimented each other very well. All of this was washed down with a bottle of great Camden Brewery pale ale.I definitely recommend a visit to Poppies if you are in or near Spitalfields. It is nostalgic meal in the middle of a modern food district and just makes you feel as though you are having a classic English experience. Highly recommended for anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

0HtcFFCI0R1tJKacCaVXsA.text: Damn, have you ever had fish as fluffy as clouds? The first meal of my London trip of course had to be some fish and chips! Had heard poppies has been around for a long while cooking up fish and chips, so decided to pop in for dinner.We all ordered the fish and chips plate, and got a side of curry sauce, gherkin, and the bread pudding. The Fish and Chips: The Fish in this thing was juicy and fluffy. I've had my share of fish all over, and this is by far the most fluffy plump fish I've had. You've gotta try it to understand what I'm trying to explain here. Get this. The Curry Sauce:  A nice addition to add some flavor to our fish and chips, but not necessary. The bread pudding: I dont know what toffee sauce they used on this but it was pure crack. Do not leave this place without giving this a try. On a side not their cappuccino was randomly amazing, and I'm not even a coffee guy. In the area or just visiting? Make sure you come by Poppies!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

Qe0J8xaAlKSudc2nKPztjQ.text: This is truly an establishment and with great customer service! The waitresses were so welcoming and nice. It was pretty crowded we got their around 6pm and waited about 20 minutes for a table, very small place but totally worth it.If you don't want to wait there is a take away option! We opted to sit down and enjoy the establishment. We got the large haddock fish n chips with extra lemon. Wow oh WOW the crispiest and lightest fried fish I've ever had in my life! The crispness of the fish is really amazing!  The mushy peas needed a lot of salt!! After adding salt they tasted ok but nothing special. I would skip them.The tartar sauce was SOOO good I wanted to slab it on everything and so I did!! I squeezed extra lemon on the fish and it still stayed crispy!  If you have a chance to try this place don't hesitate!!

Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

HrUyfyZZVlIT2nkY2H-7OA.text: Poppies is rated as one of the best fish n' chips places in London. Having eaten here, I can't understand what makes this place rated so high. While definitely, not bad, the meal wasn't great either. You are presented with three options for fish, and I went with the cod. It comes with one piece of fish and some chips (fries) on the side. Pretty standard haha. The fish was pretty good, lightly battered and the actual meat was cooked well and not overly well done. However, it was pretty bland and could use a bit extra sauce. As a result, this resulted in me having to ask for me second, third, and fourth serving of tartar sauce.The chips were pretty bland and soft. Maybe it was just too late in the night, but I was thoroughly disappointed with them.Service was great. The waiters / waitresses were attentive and explained the menu well.Overall, it was a very fun environment and while the food was disappointing given the hype, it was a decent meal in general.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cod Fish N' Chips

Bdq-ojuFXiByU-3X4pQXng.text: Named as one of the most popular fish and chip spots in London, I made it my mission to try it. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed. I honestly have no idea what made it so popular when you could probably pop into any other pub, market, or restaurant and find better fish and chips in London.We opted for the traditional fish and chips while some of us got the Cod and others with the Haddock. At £11.70, it's a bit pricey for the meal. You get one piece of fish with this thick-cut chips. While the fish itself was standard, the chips were rather dry and tasteless. Just a note, haddock has a more fishy taste than cod if you're deciding which one to get. I definitely preferred the cod. On the upside, the plate did come with these cute little containers for the tartar sauce and ketchup. These condiments were definitely needed to make the meal though.While the food was mediocre, it was the service that really pushed me to the edge. We waited a good 20 minutes trying to pay for our bill while the table next to us arrived after us had already finished.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Traditional Cod Fish & Chips.
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Traditional Cod Fish & Chips.

jM11rZaSQJlI_c_-IfbNCA.text: I'm from the east coast of the U.S where it isn't very common to find something that seems so simple. Poppies was my proper introduction to Fish & chips during my trip to London. IT WAS SO GOOD. Opted for the large cod and chips it was about £15+ to go(takeaway). The place was pretty lively around noon on a Friday, I ordered at the counter and received the food almost immediately; kinda figured id received something that was laying around but as soon as my wife and I opened that box, saw a huge helping of meaty cod with nice golden crisp fries(chips). The ladies at the counter offer to season your order with salt and malt vinegar, Ketchup and tartar sauce are also available, if youd like to season your own right outside the shop are two stations where you can do it yourself. Highly delicious, highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large Cod & chips

bP1KMUL4DbgXB5mB-yY7yQ.text: Poppies was our first meal in London and it was a bit disappointing. My husband and I shared a plate of the regular cod. It was crispy outside and moist inside. It was ok nothing special. Did not particularly care for the chips and mushy peas.  All in all this place is not my cup of tea. I can cross off that I tried fish and chips in London. Service was lacking and not memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Blah
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

F3iuCFOgq06yQoDasYwvGg.text: Good fish and chips, but not great.  We found ourselves in the restaurant with mostly other tourists and other non-locals.  I ordered the regular sized haddock & chips and my husband ordered a regular sized cod & chips. Also we shared a side of their home made mushy peas.  We enjoyed our meal - both food and the service were fine, but perhaps my expectations were set too high.  After all it is just fried fish and fries. If you happen to pass by a Poppies and are hungry, it's a good place to stop in.  But if you are on the other side of town, it's definitely not worth going out of your way for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips and mushy peas
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips

H963UwvnYhoWzAzdC1j6UQ.text: If you're looking for traditional British fish and chips, this is a great option!They have a big menu of offerings, but honestly, visit here for the fish and chips. The "smaller" order is definitely enough for one person and it was great...nice, quality fish that was perfectly fried and perfectly seasoned; the chips were also nice with good potato flavor and the right texture: soft on the inside and slightly crispy outside. We managed to find room for dessert and decided to go with another traditional British dish: sticky toffee pudding - this was also very good with nice sweetness and good creaminess from the ice cream topping.Definitely check out this awesome spot!

UBGwLuwrYMfuqjAITd1lDw.text: I was drawn to Poppies by the fact that they had a 4 star Yelp rating and it was busy when my companion and I arrived.  They serve extremely ordinary fish and chips.  It wasn't bad and it wasn't that good either.  I've had better fish and chips in several restaurants in the United States at about half the price.  The manager was friendly and hustling to get diners served, but the other servers were relatively slow and inattentive.  I personally wouldn't recommend this restaurant.If you insist on eating here, at least go for the cod over the haddock (the haddock was fishy-tasting), regular size is plenty big enough, and unless you love pea soup, you can skip the salty and slimy "mushy peas."

RH0na4JNAf69QWBrKQ0Clw.text: I actually wasn't very impressed with Poppies. This was our first meal in London and we were looking forward to having the best fish and chips we've ever had. That didn't happen. It wasn't bad though, just not great. We ordered the traditional fish and chips in both types of fish (cod and haddock) in the large size. I prefer multiple smaller pieces of smaller fried fish rather than one big fish. It was also hard to dip into the ketchup and tartar sauces that were in such small containers. The portions were good though. The hot seafood platter was only okay, as the whitebait was very fishy. We also ordered the jellied eels just to try it, and weren't huge fans. The eel was fine but I didn't care for the jelly part. The homemade mushy peas are also apparently an England thing, and they taste exactly like the name sounds and I felt like I was eating baby food. Even if I don't care for these English dishes though, I'm still very glad we ordered them and it was great that we were able to try multiple traditional dishes in one meal.The atmosphere of Poppies is fun, and the waitresses were quick to get us what we needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

1LnUWLoVBc85JON1D0USwA.text: Customer service is awesome here! Everyone is attentive to you're dining experience while you are there. Loved the 50's dive bar vibe. Fish n chips - you get you're choice of fish Cod, rock, makerrel, halibut and more! The fish is lightly battered ensuring every mouthful is filled with fresh, juicy fish! As an American i would say it needed a bit more salt but was delicious none the less. The chips were great, fresh just how I like it. Crispy on the outside and soft in the middle!

5fviK_QTARsmHFNCEbLjVA.text: Would definitely recommend this place for a real Fish n' Chips experience! I never heard of this place until I watched a YouTube video about "Places to Eat in London". My sister and I came on a Tuesday evening and there was still a wait for about 30+ mins. It was definitely worth the wait! I normally don't eat chips, but I made a consideration of course being in a famous Fish n' Chips joint. Their haddock was pretty fresh and fluffy with a perfect fried crisp. And of course, I couldn't leave once I found out they had REAL Sticky Toffee Pudding!! Which was btw....AMAZING!!Poppie's was a great experience and I'm glad to have stumbled upon it while exploring YouTube videos. :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Famous Fish n Chips!
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. They have Sticky Toffee Pudding!! :-D

Lds7waRNnPxwTgRazmu_Fw.text: Poppies fish & chips is one of those restaurants you should go to if you're in London. I mean, London is "known" for their fish and chips after all, but I somehow don't think locals really frequent this restaurant or eat much fish and chips. Anyway, I heard good things about this place before coming here and made a reservation for a Sunday night. Truth be told, you don't need a reservation as the turnover of those dining there is quite fast. They actually didn't even care when I said I had a reservation; they just led me to an available table. To no one's surprise, me and my friend ordered the cod fish and chips. to me, the fries were the best part of the meal and they weren't anything special. The fried cod was very dry and I expected more of a crunch. I would say it was even bland for my taste. The ketchup (yes, Americans you get a small ketchup!) And tartar sauce were served in these tiny jars which were cute. We ordered the poppies beer and it was a fine light beer option and why not try their special beer. Service was friendly and they helped me order a dessert (a chocolate cake/bread pudding of some sort??) in secrecy for my friends birthday and someone came out singing the happy birthday song to her embarrassment and my amusement. The dessert, however, was way too sweet.You can skip this place of it's out of the way, but it is one of londons most well known restaurants so you can give it a shot. London is known for their lackluster food, so I'm not completely shocked that this place is on the top of the London eats list.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Poppies beer
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish and chips

QEep6Hph6ENGSUN3d-1CtQ.text: Poppies kind of confuses me. I get that it's meant to be the most tourist-friendly place to consistently serve delicious fish and chips in London, but the retro 1950s decor goes right over my head. I know the owners claim that the decor harkens back to post-World War II East London, but it creates a discongruence for me because I feel like I'm dining in a kitschy American diner. It even looks like the BB gun air rifle from the movie A Christmas Story is on the wall. Really now? How quaint...But sometimes I just want classic British comfort food when I'm in London. I'm sure I'd probably get a more authentic experience if I went to a random takeaway place on the street, but the food here doesn't disappoint, especially with the generous portion sizes. The large is big enough to split with a friend, but I'd recommend getting one order of the cod fish and chips and one of the haddock so you can see which one is your favorite. (Hint: the difference in taste is extremely subtle.) The fish was fresh and perfectly fried without being not too greasy either. The chips were chips -- couldn't complain as they weren't soggy.Accept the fact that you're a tourist and check fish and chips off your London to-do list here after perusing the Spitalfields Market stalls. Try to come here for lunch because it gets crowded for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Before the lunch rush

igPOzn-Tio5tLYy4aqiQnQ.text: Went to Poppie's during our East End Food Tour last week and it did NOT disappoint! I've only ever had fish & chips in the US and I've never felt like it was "right". Poppie's gave us a small sample and it was amazing. The batter was perfectly light and crispy and it actually stuck to the cod! Usually, every fish & chips I've had, the batter was too thick and it fell off the fish, which is a sign of a bad batter. The chips were yummy and well-cooked. I suggest getting the mushy peas to go with it! Slather that baby on there like there's no tomorrow. My only thing is with this location is that there's not enough room to sit but you can always take it on the go! This is the only place I've had fish & chips in London, unfortunately, but I definitely can tell you it's worth a visit. For £12 per cod dish, it's pretty worth it when the cod is just as big as the plate.

Ay6GhzfngwTAfqlV0x2rcw.text: I ordered chicken pot pie and my husband ordered the fish and chips. The food was good, the fish being better than the pie. We got seated quickly around 1:30pm and there was an option to take-out (which is cheaper).

1NUv-up6Z2TdxFJJOG6-Dw.text: Very good fish and chips. Fried to perfection and not oily, and of course served in news paper!Would've got 5 stars but for the lack of brown sauce!

s3-cTt3D8x77rpYCV1dwuw.text: Poppies fish and chips are some of the best in London. A few months ago, I got the cod and a side of chips and it was so freakin' good. I ordered a cod with chips and it exceeded my expectations. - the batter was perfectly crispy while not being too oily. - the cod was also excellent - soft and moist- the chips were thick and not greasy (with some malt vinegar on top...oh my)Although Poppies is quite pricey, if your visiting London and want some great fish and chips look no further.

eezNfENr_gzyeNL44fhPGA.text: I heard this was the best fish and chips in town. I was not disappointed, it was really delicious however a bit greasy. it's a touristy place but pretty cute and crowded. it seems rushed but our food came quick enough and the staff were fine as well.

-kzrHJ0UTtjnaGm43M92KA.text: Wandering around the streets of Shoreditch on Sunday afternoon hungry but indecisive, we saw a sign in the distance for fish & chips and all our eyes lit up.Poppies didn't disappoint - amazing fresh, flakey and moist fish, the best fishcakes I've ever eaten (including my mums, shhh don't tell her), and lush crispyontheoutsidesoftontheinside chips!We chose to sit inside after a day of mooching and got a seat straight away.  The staff were friendly and food came quickly.  I'm not a fan of themed restaurants and could have done without the music etc - really don't think this place needs it at all and doesn't fit in with the surrounding area  (hence only 4 stars instead of 5)The portions were nice and big, just what you'd expect from a good chippy - none of us could finish, which is always a good signTop Tip1 - GET TAKEAWAY!!  Meals are at least £2 more expensive if you dine in and mushy peas double...2 - Mushy peas - get a portion to share3 - Fishcakes - they were amazing (but remember not a word to mum!)

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Most Amazing Fishcakes!!

TUG22Ur2ylt_07-g5PZUfA.text: The chips here are AMAZING. The fish was pretty good, wish I had gotten the sauce with it but otherwise the cod was fresh and the crust was crusty!! Such a cute place too- the take away option is also great because they have outdoor seating! Huge fan, will hopefully be back soon

5FEx_wEGu2tBGzxY1x3ERw.text: Fish and chips best one I've ever had. Very huge chunk of fish with min batter. Meaty fries. They won awards from seafish nationally best. Ordered regular cod and haddock with chips. Huge amount. Total 17pounds. Sit outside in front bench and order ale from the Golden heart.

ueLbKYTHlklakguRhQtlnw.text: So many good reviews for this place - am I missing something? Fish and chips were bland to say the least. Very expensive and decor had a 50's diner theme? Kinda weird for what I assumed was a traditional British fish & chips restaurant. Staff didn't seem to be fluent in English but were fairly attentive and food was fast. Overall, food just very lacking and over-priced, won't be returning.

8ubQs1tCQn6ZsS8aPGbWnQ.text: I miss Poppies like none other. Brilliantly light, crispy, flaky and filling fish & chips...without the grease hangover! I used to treat myself to a large haddock & chips once (well, *cough* sometimes twice) a week, and even brought along friends who found my obsession both amusing and/or puzzling.But in the end, I think they got it. ;)

W3uvrQLNkNIwz6HRagWUwg.text: Traditional and old school chippy kinda food, but all nicely done. The portion is ginormous, a standard regular F&C is good enough, and the large one is more than enough for 2. Fish is fresh, not heavily battered. Reasonably priced also!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large F&C (takeaway)

Jvs4Xcnj6AKuy9pfys2Axw.text: This is the place to take someone for a solid fish and chips with charm but not the grit. Like the Disney World of Fish and Chips but in a quality way. The atmosphere feels slightly "done" but when it comes to showing someone around town, the cutesy factor mostly works: the men behind the counter battering and frying are appropriately disgruntled... in a charming way, the waiters and waitresses rush around with their brows slightly furrowed (wanting to be sure you're pleased)... in a charming way. The jellied eel really jiggles in an authentic, but... not so charming way. However, the bread and butter it came with was almost like a sweet brioche so it looked and felt "authentic" but tasted better than the soggy white bread you'd get at a typical hole in the wall spot. The crust on the fish and chips was tasty on its own, and not overly greasy, the tartar sauce was nice. The chips were hit or miss, some nice crispy ones, some chunky bland ones, but douse those things in some malt vinegar and you're golden. We tried both haddock and cod, the piece of haddock was thinner and smooth, fall-apart texture whereas the cod was a chunkier piece making the meat slightly drier and more flakey. Since the piece was rather hefty, some bites were just straight up cod, which isn't really meant to speak for itself in this type of meal. I guess this is up to preferences, but with the haddock, the crust to protein ratio just felt so right!You can make reservations via the website, and since there's always at least a bit of a line about 10 or more people deep. Unless you're really going after that amusement park experience, why wait in a queue?

VqTEV-jiYuG9X6DBXlgzHw.text: Best Fish and Chips that I came across in my two week vacation searching for Fish and Chips in London. You won't leave disappointed!Take out prices are different from dine-in prices. On a nice day, you can save the money and eat right outside and enjoy the weather.

nUoDECMeK7qWwO2cRGbkZw.text: It was my second day in London and my English friend took me out to this place per my request of Fish and Chips. It was delicious! We had a yummy dinner with beer. Great London experience!

9l19aRI8akTj3EsGhaViEg.text: This is the best fish and chips London has to offer? I doubt it! But that's what a lot of people claim. It's fine. It's average. Had the haddock and chips. Which was ok. The portion is way too much so think about splitting it between two. The staff is awful. They may be slightly dim. They weren't busy but the girl at the register looked like she was about to pop a screw loose. And still she kept forgetting my drink order. Annoying. Anyway, bottom line it's ok.

HUdWGUaohoR2tvwnRvHoAg.text: I am back and this time it is even tastier!!!They are good at what they do, so good they even have fridge trays full of fishes made to your order, despite they didnt have what I wanted.Just a side note, they dont sound English at all; they sound more like Italian, or maybe its just me who had slices pepperoni stuck in my ears.If you are buying to take away, the reception is a bit rude or not happy at what he does.  They do charges your for tartar sauce, which is a bit distasteful. Seems like they never have Rock fish, I will be back for their Rock fish!!!The End.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Rock Fish!
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Rock fish! It's better than cod!

ssdCzb4l0oqOcJd1NFU4NQ.text: An alternative 50's themed fish & chips restaurant with a beautiful decoration, great service and nice food!The Haddock, Plaice and Mackerel are great and no meal for me starts without some tasty whitebait that just hits the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Decor

c2qiez2mQJntEEI04njV6g.text: Love, love, love this adorable fish and chips shop in London!  Cute decor, spot-on prices, friendly service...I really enjoyed my fried fish and french fries!  My friend ordered the grilled fish, a much healthier option and one that I'm happy Poppie's offers, though I never order "healthy." I also liked that the restaurant wasn't full of tourists (technically, like myself) on a weekday afternoon.  It felt very local, and for that reason, far more fun.

umWFi3eJ4w_RvsnkLPbdYQ.text: My first trip to London w/my mom and we were told to make the long (sort've) trek to Poppies and it was so worth it. The best fish & chips I've ever had, and we still bring it up every now and then LOL

bnOPa_ac2b16qZF_hjw6BA.text: Ordered the large haddock and a couple beers. Would do that 1x/week if I lived here. Easily the best fish & chips I've ever had. Very fresh fish and super fluffy chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large haddock and chips

OA5rksuqsb9vgiB187qXow.text: This place is in the midst of hipsterville near Brick Lane. It also a reputation that might precede itself. But I took my foreign friends here after they arrived recently and they really enjoyed the place. Some good haddock and chips.

EOjoDh8NhNg1DEoHZjD2jQ.text: Really nice feel to the place. We made a reservation which was a good idea as the place is really busy but they have a good takeout option as well. The cod fish was really good and crisp. However they were out of two of the 3 most popular options (halibut and haddock), so we all had to order cod. Experience could have been better had we had the chance to try different ones. Service was nice and very quick

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

sJunVYmyveSGucJozQQZwQ.text: more hype. more disappointment. i had the seafood platter because i wanted a quick sample of what they had. the cod was pretty good - delicately fried, slightly oily but not very flavorful. ive had better in queens (check out banter on queens blvd). the calamari was pretty awful. it tasted fishy and was overfried. i dont think i 'get' the whitebait, which are tiny little fried fish that are kinda funky and sad looking. london...u make me sadface.

LStqaGTCa-k1RkAh_ohdlw.text: Friendly service and decent food! I thought the haddock tasted better than the cod. Very touristy spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Regular sized fried cod!

mCO6vgqbOpjcKJkTACrjUw.text: A local brought me here. We were in a group of 6 and we all ordered the traditional cod and chips. The portions were huge and we all couldn't finish it. It was good though. I took one star away because of the rude waiter we had. Overall, the food is good.

Vf4DkR3I8sBclv840juIPA.text: Service is quick and friendly. The portion of one order (regular) is enough for two people, or just order the large size for two people. The hoddock has a fishy taste, barely noticeable, while the cod does not have any fishy taste. I liked the haddock more. The order comes with a large order of thickly cut fries. The atmosphere of the restaurant is fun and light hearted. My boyfriend and I tried to mushy peas because it's something unfamiliar to us in the states, but ended up just being mushed peas (like baby food). I would not recommend it if you generally don't like peas or am not a fan. I gave it four stars because the meal was good but did not WOW me, nothing about it particularly stood out. Would return for another casual lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Long, thick piece of haddock and a slender pieces of cod, with a side a mushy peas

GybIlg9Lu3rNbRFklD5Mew.text: I don't know anything about fish and chips but I loved Poppie's. In fact, I used to hate it after I had tried it a few times in London pubs on previous visits (when I used to be a tourist here héhé). I came with the recommendations of a friend who used to live in London, and I wasn't disappointed with the food. The service, on the other hand, was very poor.The restaurant has a 50's vibe to it and they added these funny 50's housewives memes on the wall. Made me laugh as I was facing it. I'd recommend taking it to go as the service is nothing extraordinary, the place gets crowded, and you soon feel like you are a canned sardine.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

QbTlOE-Z-3oygnKbZ8Sv2A.text: I wanted authentic and I got it here!  The fish and chips were incredible... very light and crispy outside and flaky inside. Of course, I had to have my salt n vinegar on the chips. Beer, Beer, and Beer, all great pints. Toffy Pudding was to die for. A bit pricey, but who cares, you only live once.  Highly recommended.

z-6kFBd8C9mOlZMz_r3VYg.text: A great recommendation from a friend who traveled here not too long ago! My husband and I got here right before the lunch rush so we were able to score a table very quickly. We know what we wanted since poppies is know for their fish and chips so I went for the haddock and my husband got the cod. We ordered a side of mushy peas since that's what you are suppose to eat with fish and chips? Anyways, our food came out pretty quick and these are pretty big portions. You get a sizable piece of fish for the regular size. I'm not sure what you would get for the larger size! So out of the cod and haddock, I preferred the haddock as it seemed juicier to me then the cod. For the mushy peas, I didn't particularly like this at first but after awhile it grew on me. You are not missing out if you opt out of mushy peas lol. The 'chips' were fresh and crisp as well. This is a great lunch option and super filling as well! You can dine in or order to go so it's super convienent!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Haddock with a side of mushy peas
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Beer

IsoSVSlRDHVK6xj961GmoQ.text: We like it here very much... friendly little shop with a lot guests and a good atmosphere....We eat the classic fish and chips made from Cod.. very delicious. The home made dip was also very good. Thank you for a nice evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

596qDYbKNb4SCz8Dj6jLWg.text: Waited in a bit of a line for a table while eyeballing all the takeaway heading out the door in cones and boxes.  The place didn't smell greasy or fishy, which I took as a good sign.We got the cod, and I was initially a little worried when I saw the skin was still on.  Luckily, my worry was unwarranted - the fish was fresh, the coating was crisp and delicious, and the chips were great.  I added a side of gravy because I'm a sucker, but I totally did not need it - malt vinegar and salt were perfect additions.  Tried a couple of local beers, which were just okay, but we didn't come here for the beer.A seriously solid choice for fish and chips.

wg3fKKOwvcAJci9qFinXKA.text: Friends were recommended Poppies by a local who claimed it was the best around Shoreditch. I'd have to politely disagree.Prices:Kind of expensive, definitely not fast food prices, but reminiscent to the Americans' Ruby's. Kind of what you'd expect out of the place.Service: Prompt & polite. No complaints! Very friendly.Food:I've had better Fish & Chips. While the cod I ordered wasn't dry, it wasn't very moist either. A little on the oily side & not too full of flavor. I didn't dislike this fish, but I wasn't crazy about it. I just think it could've been better. Perhaps I should've chosen the Plaice or Halibut. The seafood sampler was okay too. I did however, enjoy the mushy peas with a little pinch of salt (why England, why? Why so bland?). The tea I got was really good though. Can't complain about tea!Environment:50s diner that has a lower level bathroom area. Rather medium interior, but it's also very cramped. Did deal with very obnoxious patrons, which isn't the restaurant's fault at all...but when a woman originally from the UK asks you to identify mushy peas & claims she's from Jersey.........where do these people .... I don't even...GO HOME. Oh wait, she's supposedly already home...omg whatever, GO BACK TO JERSEY. YOU'RE BAD & YOU SHOULD FEEL BAD. Would not say this place is the best. Would not recommend it, but if you're in the area, it doesn't hurt to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Beef Pot Pie
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips

FgAmBscebdANltDv1RNPMw.text: Poppies is a great spot for fish and chips. There are many many places in the UK for this type of cuisine but poppies is pretty consistent.Their fish is very light and flaky. The batter is lightly fried and crispy.I do not care for their chips as they are rather limp. I like them crispy on the outside light and fluffy on the inside.Mashy peas are the bomb....just the best.The decor is very american Kitschy....america has many themes like this. Chillis, Mels, TGIF etc....but the similarities end there.Good place for fish and chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. This is Poppie: The man, the myth,....the legend. Nice guy to boot.

vlmbQfMYHA23FF190n8qsQ.text: When arrived in London, the first thing I wanted to eat was Fish & Chips. Personally, I think the place is over-hyped. I've had better Fish & Chips in America (and that's kinda sad). I'm not saying it's bad though!Service was not particularly friendly, and make sure you request a table before ordering - because we accidentally ordered first (hey, it was our first time!) and were forced to sit outside and eat while standing...I do really love the neighborhood though. Pretty hipster, and we saw Khal Drogo at the bar down the street (which seemed poppin') so you should definitely explore Shoreditch and if you're craving some standard Fish & Chips, I GUESS you could go here.

OCBKDrbajGY4Zyd3wIE_IA.text: Arrived in London and did a little research. Picked this place. Loved it. Food was incredibly fresh, crisp and hot.  I hade the haddock and chips, wife had the cod. WOW..

4MlCypZqoagSb0S_pC6eJQ.text: First let me start with the food then service. The fish and chips was okay. Of course I knew it would be different from how I eat fish in USA. If you like your fish well seasoned just add a lot of salt and vinegar to your fish. The service was horrible, we sat down and the waitress took our order but did not return. People around us that sat down after us got their food and was almost done before we got ours. I had to ask another waitress what was taking so long and our waitress forgot our entire order. Because of customer service I have to rate this place 2 stars.

Z2zDg2kPLAE_lK_nzcT9-w.text: Tip: Poppies has a dine-in and take-out menu where prices are cheaper for take-out.Came here with a friend to dine-in, and we weren't disappointed, except for the longer waiting time. We shared a large cod fish and chips and a calamari appetizer. Because of the calamari, which was freshly made, our food which came altogether, took a while.The fish and chips were the star of the night. They managed to make a deep fried dish not overly greasy, with the chips made from fresh potatoes. I suspect their chips may not be twice fried, hence not achieving the crispness, but I didn't mind it as I do love my chips slightly mushy. Our cod flaked nicely and wasn't over done. Batter was light and not overly chunky, *almost* like an English version of tempura! Everything went well with lemon and tartar sauce. Yum!Our calamari was over-priced, with 5 thick rings for £5. Probably would not order it again because of the waiting time.Would I come back again? Yes, for a quick dinner and a fish and chips fix!

5eTHNssWhM1XTIOfbSo0_g.text: Best fish & chips in London. I had a few fish & chips in London, Poppies excels above the rest. The cod was cooked to perfection.  A must visit when in London!

eyua6kEVppQtppyz2Vd4wA.text: Went there because it's known as the best place for fish and chips. We tried the brick lane place . Fish was really good and the presentation is really cute with mini jars for dipping sauces. But the fries where meh... They could improve the quality of the fries and they would be perfect!

GUZ1SoVAD6ztXBxKZJyixg.text: If you want real fish and chips, don't go here. I didn't like it at all. I've heard about this place from a food tour, and it didn't live up to the expectations and hype. The fish and chips were bland. There was no difference between the haddock and cod. The taste of both fish were tasteless. First of all, the service was meh, and it took forever for them to bring our food. The food was a lot, but it was too pricey for fish and chip. You are better off getting fish and chip from your local chips shop. Those local places taste better than this place. I really think they are using their name and brand to sell tasteless food. Also, they sat us really close to other patrons, which I didn't like. I understand the establishment is small, but do I have to hear the conversations of other people while I eat. I couldn't even focus on my own thoughts, and I wasn't able to talk to my brother, the person I came with. My brother was disappointed in this place, and this was his first time having fish and chips in London. Not worth it. Go to your local fish and chip shop.

td6KzJgxZgzUHDZabH0vzw.text: Probably the best fist and chips I had in London. I tried a bunch of places and this place is the best bang for your buck.The fish and chips were fresh off the fryer and it made the difference. I would've given 5 stars but you guys charge for ketchup?!

dhdqeWLVEPlXTEy5huITDQ.text: Battered cod dry and tough.They were quite busy so how can the fish be not fresh.Grilled fish ,lemon sole with no taste also.Tourist attraction. and trap.Quite espensive too.But Happy Days was not open on the Bank Holiday so we came here.

7mQGn6swpCEl2PXiIggBoQ.text: On my parents first day in London, we went to Poppies on a friend's recommendation for some traditional fish and chips. We immediately were taken back in time to an American 1950s diner. You could definitely tell this was geared towards pleasing tourists and my parents weren't complaining!The service was attentive and enthusiastic, even posing in a photo with my family. We ordered a large portion of both the cod and haddock. One large was definitely enough to feed the three of us. The fish and chips could definitely use a bit more seasoning but I find that to be the case for most fish and chips in London. Nevertheless, it was nothing a little mayo, ketchup, or even some whole grain mustard couldn't fix. Definitely stop by Poppies and head right across to the Old Spitalfields Market for a bit of shopping!

5EccDOd9Mi-WHdhJfqlDCw.text: When in London, one must experience Fish and Chips.  We did a little research on Yelp and decided on Poppie's. Made a reservation and got seated right away. Place is small so I recommend calling in advance. I ordered the small cod with chips. The cod was moist and delicious with lovely crunchy exterior. Probably one of the best pieces of fried fish I've ever had. Hubby ordered the seafood platter. We took off one star for one of the items on that platter- the white bait tasted very unpleasant.  Poppie's is cool little trendy place.

faKD2I294K29j8rLM09itQ.text: Good, not great. The fish and chips are a large portion and for the most part fresh, but the service isn't great (we in fact waited 30 minutes for a drink even though we asked our waitress twice) and the place gets very very busy at lunchtime. It definitely has more of a daytime than a nighttime feel about it: cheery checked interior with a 1950s theme. Overall, I'd pass on this place if I was looking specifically for fish and chips. But there's a place in my heart for dives that wrap everything at their chippers in newspaper, so I'm probably not one to judge!

GOCX-4nXhpsuOKqsokLWMw.text: I doubt this is the best fish & chips in london, came here by a neighbor recommendation.I'm still in the seek of the very special one.In case you haven't found a better one, this is worth a visit, if you're around and want to have a decent dinner in a nice atmosphere.Place is clean, and welcoming !!

vyEeO7wrdluV9f_zxb9UAw.text: I maybe a noob on Fish 'n Chips in UK, but it met(or went beyond) what I just expected. I was just freakin' happy to have my 1st ever fish 'n chips in UK soil, OK?I thought everything was bigger in US than anywhere else in the world. But wow.. This place has been operated for a long time and give you a special atmosphere, with the caring of the old days.  We thought the food was good and authentic.   Seating is tight and limited.  It is a popular place.
